Bachelors degree a plus, mutual fund industry background preferred. 1-2 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in accounting support or the mutual fund industry preferred. column2: Client Product & Profitability Manager (LOB CFO I)
column4: The Line of Business (LOB) CFO I – Client Product and Profitability Manager is a direct report of the LOB CFO II or Director of Investment Services FP&A serves as finance business partner and advisor for a smaller line of business or product segment.  Provides management reporting, business analytics, and guidance to support target setting, performance management, and improved growth and profitability. Ensures the needs of the business are met by the services Finance provides.  Coordinates across Finance and other advisory services supporting the business to ensure integration in financial reporting and analysis activities. Works with client and financial planning and analysis teams to suggest improvements to financial analytics and reporting to better assist the business in making decisions.  Identifies areas where further analysis is needed.  Provides guidance on the development of key performance indicators.  Participates in goal setting activities for the business. Provides financial advice on the development of strategic and operating plans for the business. Partners with Human Resources to effectively manage human capital costs and workforce planning initiatives.Client Product and Profitability Manager is responsible to: · --Define the CPP vision, implement a common client profitability methodology and framework across Investment Services, and integrate CPP vision with other management reporting tools.· --Integrate client profitability into pricing of existing clients to create transparency and  inform decision  making· -- Provide data analytics to enhance new business opportunities           · -- Drive the development of a better front end system· -- Manage monthly/quarterly update(s) process of CPP system· --Ensure appropriate governance in controls and data validation· -- Lead a team of 10+ people Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting, or business or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance is preferred. MBA, CFA or local country equivalent preferred. 12-15 years of total work experience with 3-5 years of management experience preferred.Preferred Experience: 12+ years progressive accounting and financial analysis experience with at least 8 years of management experience, 3 of those at the senior level. In-depth broad-based knowledge of advanced financial management concepts and managerial accounting and reporting concepts and processes. Highly-specialized knowledge of and experience in business-specific requirements of the line of business area/s supported. Excellent communication (verbal, written), presentation, and consultative skills. Strong business and strategic perspective/focus are essential. Chief Financial Officer or Finance senior management for a large financial services institution. Minimum Language Skills: Strong written and oral communications skills in English. Other: Certified Public Accountant (CPA), or Chartered Accountant (CA), or equivalent certification issued by local area Professional Licensing body.  Candidate is expected to have experience in one or more of the leading Activity Based Costing/Management tools, knowledge of relational databases (SQL), data cleansing and advanced (macro) Excel skills.  SAS ABM experience is a plus. Preferred Skills:· --Cross-functional leadership capability· --Working business knowledge of Asset Servicing, Treasury Services, Pershing,  Clearance and Collateral Management, Depository Receipts and Corporate Trust businesses·  --Working knowledge of underlying modeling tools (SAS, Business Objects, and Oracle)      -- Activity based Costing and Modeling· --Financial Reporting & Analysis BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Supports a standard legal entity, line of business, country, region or accounting process, as assigned. Contributes to the completion of numerous activities from start to close, including consolidations and financial reporting of business outcomes to deliver useable, accurate and timely financial information for the desired period (monthly, quarterly or annually). May complete other assignments, as needed, including standard accounting activities. Assists with end to end accounting processes and research required to transform data into information for reporting purposes. Activities may include processing standard general ledger events and transactions, assisting with continuous improvement activities such as the identification and analysis of exceptions, providing support for audits and completing assigned tasks to support the maintenance of the control environment. May complete special project activities, as assigned. Contributes to the completion of journal entries. With guidance, performs reconciliations of general ledger accounts or other financial data. Identifies and escalates issues, as needed. May review journal entries and/or reconciliations completed by less experienced professionals. Participates in assignments across lines of business, legal entities and geographies that have an impact on internal reporting, accounting and accounting processes. Assignments may include contributing to the implementation of new or revised reporting, accounting and accounting process policies, procedures and reporting templates in order to provide effective financial planning, accounting and reporting of financial information. Accounting concentration preferred. 3-5 years of total work experience preferred; knowledge of GAAP and accounting and finance concepts and analysis techniques preferred. Experience designing financial models and accounting processes preferred. Responsible for establishing and maintaining the framework of processes, policies, systems and activities required for the management of vendor and legal entity inter-relationships across all global Legal Entities and branches. Identifies gaps in key regulator global requirements and designs, develops and leads programs to ensure these gaps are closed. Establishes and coordinates processes to evaluate the quality of supplier and interaffiliate performance across the organization. Directs the activities of professional staff and more junior managers responsible for consolidating compliance and performance information into an aggregate format; presents reporting to global senior management. Maintains strong working relationships with key business partners throughout the organization, including senior roles in Risk, Global Procurement, Finance, IT, HR and Legal. Independently provides expertise to the policy writing, liquidity assessments, analytical research, data gathering, calculations, modeling and forecasting related to controlling the risks associated with assets, liabilities, liquidity funding, capital and IRR management. Interfaces with internal and external stakeholders and continues to build a broad range of knowledge spanning the range of treasury, capital and asset and liability categories across the organization and its varied products/services. Typically specializes in ALM matters such as Intraday Liquidity, Deposit Liabilities, Interest Rate Risk, Currency Risk, Capital Management and Planning, etc. and/or oversees the full scope of activities for assigned region/entity(ies). Manages entities with more complex liquidity risk and capital management frameworks. Establishes the technical direction for complex calculations or elements of assigned ALM specialty. Provides input into development of the ALM policy and strategy for assigned entity(ies) in alignment with Corporate guidance and regulatory requirements. Serves as a subject matter expert and advises more junior professionals on improving their knowledge and how to address more complex or unusual issues. Collects financial data, validates, and populates various capital management, IRR, liquidity and asset/liability models or analyses. Runs the model/analyses, conducts liquidity stress testing and reports on results. Ensures models are functioning as expected; troubleshoots and reports on unexpected/undesired results. Assesses risk inherent in any new or changing Bank products and adjusts model inputs. Provides technical guidance to less experienced team members on complex issues. Internationally, reviews, analyzes, recommends and executes complex capital and asset liability management activities. Completes projects and assigns tasks to more junior professionals. Contributes to discussions with investment and asset liability managers on allocation decisions, risk management and changes to improve alignment with the ALM and Capital Planning and Management framework. Develops approaches for enhancing measurement and reporting. With management, leads the development of policies and procedures related to the model(s) and underlying assumptions, limitations. Ensures alignment to liquidity risk position and any regulatory requirements. Develops and documents liquidity self-assessments and liquidity funding contingency plans. Prepares reports that provide clear and accurate analyses and that identify and track risks. Ensures proper controls on the quality and integrity of reports produced for senior management and ALM committee processes. Cultivates relationships with peers in the businesses, Risk Management, Finance and Corporate Treasury to ensure efficient collection of data/model inputs. May provide advice on specific business decisions that will affect liquidity, capital, or interest rate risk. Often represents the Bank in interactions with applicable regulators. Anticipates changes in the regulatory environment and the business; conducts applicable research and makes recommendations for responding to emerging/changing regulatory requirements affecting ALM, Capital or Liquidity Funding. Conducts special projects and ad-hoc analyses/reporting as requested. Often serves as a project lead, engaging peers across the Bank and providing task oversight. Provides informal supervision to less experienced ALM team members. No direct reports. Provides leadership to less experienced team members, guiding and coaching them on their work accuracy and quality. Provides project leadership, including informal performance management of assigned project teams. May contribute to the technical direction of discipline. Contributes to the achievement of functional objectives. Advice has direct impact on the risk or financial position of the entity(ies) supported. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Degree in math, engineering, statistics, computational finance or economics preferred. MBA, CFA, or CPA/CA preferred. 10-12 years of total work experience preferred. Experience with liquidity stress testing, liquidity risk management, interest rate risk management, capital management and/or asset-liability management within large complex financial organizations preferred. Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. BNY Mellon Source
to Pay (S2P), including program, technology and process elements, has significantly
developed since introduction in 2014, and now incorporates strategic
initiatives to meet Global Procurement and Third Party Governance objectives,
as well as cost control and management of BNY Mellon’s vendors.
 
The Specialist
Source to Pay will support Global Procurement and Business/Business Partner
stakeholders as the SME and functional lead for eProcurement and associated
elements of the Source to Pay (S2P) systems and processes.
 
Broad scope of
the role:
·        
BAU management of S2P technology and processes
·        
Identification of process and system issues
preventing wider eProcurement adoption
·        
Managing process and system changes to address
identified issues; includes wider stakeholder engagement and analysis to assure
adequate control mechanisms remain in place
·        
Analysis of required controls, and ensuring
systems/processes in place
·        
Identifying opportunities and
developing/managing projects to meet defined objectives
·        
Analysis and reporting to support S2P process
management and optimization
 
Detailed Description
 
The Specialist
Source to Pay will manage the system and processes, focusing primarily but not
exclusively on eProcurement functions, to enable defined S2P goals to be
met.  In order to lead the function, the
individual is required to comprehensively understand the nature of eProcurement
operations and technology, and related factors. 
The individual will require knowledge of P2P/S2P, including delivery of
an eProcurement function and management of eProcurement systems and processes as
a part of wider P2P/S2P. They will manage/lead process optimisation and system
enhancement objectives and functionally coordinate across lines of business
within BNY Mellon to enable eProcurement processes to be adopted.
 
The individual
will be responsible for implementing to S2P / eProcurement related controls and
activities to assure compliance and effective risk management/mitigation. Other
specific responsibilities: identification of inefficiencies and wider
optimization opportunities and taking action to address them; analysis and
reporting to support S2P process management and optimization, including:
adoption and optimization analysis; routine performance reporting; reporting of
summary information to management in order to drive effective decision making;
preparation and delivery of executive level reporting/dashboarding on key
objectives; ad-hoc reporting requests.
 
The individual
will also functionally manage offshore and outsource resource delivering S2P
support and execution, including input to performance management and
development.
 
This role has a
global impact across BNY Mellon, and will require collaboration with
stakeholders across many Business lines and Business Partner Groups as well as
external parties (e.g. vendors), therefore strong relationship management
skills are required. Management of change and implementation of initiatives will
be key, and the ability to understand the impact of change at the
organizational level and regulatory requirements are a core requirement. Where
issues fall outside the direct scope of eProcurement, the individual must be
able to influence and work collaboratively with wider stakeholders. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education
and work experience required; 5-7 years of total work experience preferred;
knowledge of procurement practices and ERP required. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Responsible for the ongoing, independent oversight of complex business continuity compliance activities and recovery management governance for an assigned function and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other risks. Advises and assists the assigned function with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Plans for both standard and non-standard business continuity risks and appropriately directs the function's activities to address any control gaps. Supports the business line managers via the cross company Business Recovery Coordinator network to ensure the company is meeting both client and regulatory requirements related to Business Continuity. This includes providing training and awareness on required deliverables, tracking and monitoring for completion, conducting quality assurance reviews and reporting back to management, as required. Directs the assigned function's identification of risks to functional resilience and completion of test recoveries and relocations as required by all applicable regulators and legal entities. Advises the function on the completion of responsibilities in relation to required test recoveries and relocations and develops projects and programs to improve compliance. May complete similar tasks for vendor continuity. Contributes to the evaluation of testing protocols each year in response to personnel changes, among others. Consistently directs cross-functional efforts to promote a strong Business Continuity & Recovery culture throughout the organization. Directly contributes to the drafting of the master resolution and recovery playbook for the organization, including documenting actions to be taken in the event of a crisis or bankruptcy. Uses growing knowledge of industry best practices to anticipate critiques from regulators. Meets with existing clients on an ongoing basis. Uses longstanding, strong working relationships with existing clients to ensure the completion of business continuity compliance activities when clients are in the process of purchasing new services or conducting due diligence required by their vendors. Assigns compliance activities to more junior professionals. Escalates significant business continuity issues to the Business Continuity Executive Committee. Helps to determine whether the risks associated with a client contract are tolerable for the organization. No direct reports; provides guidance to more junior team members and may assign tasks, as needed. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 10-12 years of total work experience preferred. The Regulatory Reporting Production team is the largest team within the EMEA Finance Professional Services Centre responsible for producing internal and external regulatory reporting returns across multiple EMEA locations. 
   
 Job Purpose/ Responsibilities (What the job role involves)
 


 Production of EMEA external regulatory, statistical and liquidity returns within prescribed regulatory deadlines.  These reporting deadlines have frequencies of daily, monthly, quarterly, half yearly, yearly and ad hoc 

 Production of internal regulatory reporting for business management and decision making.  

 Work in a strong operational control environment for data production and reporting e.g. certification, analytical review and checklists are carried out to the required level.  Adherence to regulatory governance policies 

 Work with other functional and business areas e.g. Treasury, Risk, Compliance, Legal and Business line management in the production of regulatory returns.  

 Projects to support the business in its objectives as regards to regulatory reporting and compliance with new regulatory rules and advisory work on business changes and restructures. 

 Provide support, advice and education to the business and business partners departments on the impact of new business and new regulatory rules 

 Other: Stay abreast of legislative and regulatory developments, as well as maintain their knowledge of External Reporting requirements and procedures.  Perform other functions as required from time-to-time. 
 
Requirements; (what we are looking for)
 


 Newly qualified accountant or qualified through experience 

 Regulatory reporting experience preferable  

 Deadline driven with a strong attention to detail 

 Experience of a fast moving, complex, highly controlled, multi-national/ functional organization 

 Analytical with an inquisitive/challenging mind set 

 Controls experience essential 

 Significant experience of accounting systems and processes (e.g. strong user of excel) 
 Data analytical experience desirable. #LI-KB1  Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater Manchester-Manchester Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 32218 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1818769

column2: Sr. Group Mgr, Third Party Governance (TPG)
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Manager for Third Party Governance Policies manages a team that is responsible for creating and maintaining Third Party Governance policies, procedures, guidelines, SLAs, and training that comply with US and regional regulations. The Manager would need to build the team by hiring high performing staff. This is a highly visible role and the Manager will need to work closely with senior executives across the company. 
 Primary Responsibilities Include:  
   
 Third Party Governance Policies:


 Create and maintain in an evergreen fashion a comprehensive set of Third Party Governance policies  

 Work with Legal and Compliance teams to ensure that the policies comply with the US and regional regulations 

 Work with Procurement, Corporate data and Security teams to ensure that the policies are optimized and not overlapping 

 Obtain necessary approvals or no-objections from Risk and other lines of defenses for the policies 

 Publish the policies and train the stakeholders on a periodic basis 
Third Party Procedures, Guidelines, and SLAs:


 Whenever a policy is revised or a new policy is created, work with Third Party Governance teams to create and implement detailed operating procedures, guidelines and SLAs 

 Assess the effectiveness of the procedures on an annual basis and make improvements as necessary 

 Be responsible for the Third Party Governance Risk Control Self Assessment (RCSA) and associated action items  
Staff Development:


 Build the team by hiring high performing staff 

 Direct, motivate, and develop staff  

 Responsible for employee satisfaction and performance management of the team 
Communications:


 Proactively communicate the upcoming changes to stakeholders 

 Develop close relationships with key stakeholders across Compliance, Legal, Risk, and Audit teams and keep them informed of emerging changes 
 Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and is not afraid of hard work and long hours (when needed) and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities.   Qualifications 

 12 – 15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience preferred 

 1-3 years of experience managing teams, with a track record of promoting team members is preferred 

 1-3 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Procurement, Strategy, Management Consulting, Compliance, Legal, Audit, Risk, Policies/Procedures areas is preferred 

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience is required 

 MBA from a top institute is preferred, but not required 

 Management consulting experience is preferred, but not required 

 Process optimization experience is preferred, but not required 

 Military experience is preferred, but not required  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. The Corporate Treasury group is responsible for managing the investment portfolios and the liquidity and capital positions of the various subsidiary banks and of  BNY Mellon.BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Responsible for the ongoing, independent oversight of standard business continuity compliance tasks and recovery management governance for an assigned function and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other risks. Assists the assigned function with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Prepares reports for more senior professionals. Supports the business line managers via the cross company Business Recovery Coordinator network to ensure the company is meeting both client and regulatory requirements related to Business Continuity. This includes providing training and awareness on required deliverables as well as tracking and monitoring for completion. With minimal guidance, assists the assigned function with the identification of risks to functional resilience and completion of test recoveries and relocations as required by all applicable regulators and legal entities. Helps the function to develop projects and programs to improve compliance. May complete similar tasks for vendor continuity. May contribute to the evaluation of testing protocols each year in response to personnel changes, among others. Is beginning to contribute to cross-functional efforts to promote a strong Business Continuity & Recovery culture throughout the organization. May attend meetings and continue to build relationships with existing clients. No direct reports. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. 
   
 Responsible for business monitoring and supporting incident response for Securities Operations and Cash and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other business risks. Assists Business Resiliency Intelligence (BRI) with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Prepares reports for more senior professionals.  Monitoring service health for all Securities processes settlements, trade capture, corporate actions, income including strategic key metrics for the business eg: market impact, flow across the lifecycle, latency/throughput and application health (this role will be cross trained for Cash monitoring as well)

 Interacting with executive management and clients for specific showcase visits to demonstrate monitoring capabilities  

 Reviews work with more senior professionals. May attend meetings and continue to build relationships with existing clients. No direct reports. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives.  Qualifications Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Accountable for establishing and maintaining the global vendor or interaffiliate-TPG framework. Drives change management processes to achieve outsourcing management consistency and global operating efficiency and embed an effective global risk management culture while meeting all regulatory and legal requirements. Interprets regulatory changes and enforces their implementation in a way that achieves results while satisfying the requirements of relevant regulators. Holds management accountable for regulatory compliance and the delivery of products and services from third party vendors and through interaffiliate relationships. Is accountable for developing consistent and robust processes to sustain compliance with global regulatory and legal requirements, providing transparency and comfort to all lines of business and the Executive board and ensuring continued high levels of service delivery. Defines the global strategy and direction for vendor and interaffiliate governance, control and risk. Leads the initial and ongoing development of the TPG global framework with a focus on all global regulatory requirements. Directs the development of materials from regulatory guidelines into workable and measureable global training and support solutions. Advises on and delivers vendor and interaffiliate-focused solutions to TPG requirements using significant industry expertise. Regularly engages with regulators and executive level stakeholders to understand requirements and drive global compliance. Advises senior and executive stakeholders on methods of ensuring compliance. Ensures regulatory requirements and quality standards across the global vendor and interaffiliate population. Maintains a worldwide overview of all interactions with relevant regulators on all outsourcing matters relevant to the vendor and interaffiliate population in coordination with senior management, the Legal Department and Compliance. Ensures appropriate and up to date contractual documentation exists and is accessible. Scopes and owns the development of strategies for the efficient implementation of global TPG policies, processes and systems. Establishes standards for day to day interactions with functional stakeholders including Legal, Compliance and Risk to ensure TPG processes are maintained to a standard that is acceptable to regulators. Leads regular meetings to assess the quality of the global TPG framework delivery and discuss any other relevant topics in relation to the outsourced services with senior level TPG group members, sponsors, stakeholders and vendors. Ensures more junior professional staff are managing vendor and interaffiliate relationships in scope with appropriate measurement and management tools and other related documentation. Designs and enforces a consistent approach to BAU outsourcing management worldwide and across legal entities. Communicates robust global metrics and reporting on outsourcing activity to senior management. Ensures appropriate changes to regulatory requirements are identified and responses and new ways of working are developed to maintain a positive control on global regulatory governance. Drives the design and implementation of an information repository to hold all completed outsourcing documentation. Uses existing strong strategic relationships with all key stakeholders such as Business and Legal Entity Managers and all key stakeholders and vendors to produce favorable conditions for TPG and ensure global regulatory compliance. Works closely with senior contacts within the TPG group in order to present a single client face to global customers. No direct reports. Leads more junior staff. Contributes to the achievement of global objectives and fulfillment of local and regional accountabilities. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. 10-12 years of total work experience preferred. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Fund/Client Accounting - S4

Serves as a lead for the day-to-day operations of a small fund accounting support team, providing work direction and technical assistance on complex matters.

Helps to lead the day-to-day accounting and net asset value (NAV) production functions (including NAV construction & validation, NAV review, dissemination and reporting activities) for more complex funds. Assists in reviewing data and assists in resolving escalated problems that may arise during the normal daily, weekly or monthly accounting and reporting.

Tracks data and maintains accounting records for funds of higher complexity in accordance with department policies and procedures.  Assists in establishing data maintenance and summarization processes to improve team efficiency and best support the accounting team.

Assists in leading team in preparing system-generated reports.  Coordinates review of reports and the sharing of reports with accounting teams.  Reviews work of junior team members.

Regularly works with client staff to exchange information with respect to cash, accounting, and reporting of daily and monthly client activities and initiatives.  Communicates data needs and answers client questions.

Assists in identifying and implementing process improvements to reduce audit and financial exposure and improve team efficiency.

No direct reports;; may have work allocation and team lead responsibilities .

Supports the achievement of team objectives. Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 3-5 years of total work experience preferred;; experience in accounting support preferred. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. analyst for all corporate development activity, which includes M&A, large

quarterly market metrics process. Assists in developing recommendations on improving efficiency and effectiveness against benchmarks. Participates in the development of annual operating, capital and strategic plans. Compiles financial information and conducts analysis as needed. column3:
Multiple Locations:
New York, New York; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
column4:
BNY Mellon Source
to Pay (S2P), including program, technology and process elements, has significantly
developed since introduction in 2014, and now incorporates strategic
initiatives to meet Global Procurement and Third Party Governance objectives,
as well as cost control and management of BNY Mellon’s vendors.
 
The Specialist
Source to Pay will support Global Procurement and Business/Business Partner
stakeholders as the SME and functional lead for eProcurement and associated
elements of the Source to Pay (S2P) systems and processes.
 
Broad scope of
the role:
·        
BAU management of S2P technology and processes
·        
Identification of process and system issues
preventing wider eProcurement adoption
·        
Managing process and system changes to address
identified issues; includes wider stakeholder engagement and analysis to assure
adequate control mechanisms remain in place
·        
Analysis of required controls, and ensuring
systems/processes in place
·        
Identifying opportunities and
developing/managing projects to meet defined objectives
·        
Analysis and reporting to support S2P process
management and optimization
 
Detailed Description
 
The Specialist
Source to Pay will manage the system and processes, focusing primarily but not
exclusively on eProcurement functions, to enable defined S2P goals to be
met.  In order to lead the function, the
individual is required to comprehensively understand the nature of eProcurement
operations and technology, and related factors. 
The individual will require knowledge of P2P/S2P, including delivery of
an eProcurement function and management of eProcurement systems and processes as
a part of wider P2P/S2P. They will manage/lead process optimisation and system
enhancement objectives and functionally coordinate across lines of business
within BNY Mellon to enable eProcurement processes to be adopted.
 
The individual
will be responsible for implementing to S2P / eProcurement related controls and
activities to assure compliance and effective risk management/mitigation. Other
specific responsibilities: identification of inefficiencies and wider
optimization opportunities and taking action to address them; analysis and
reporting to support S2P process management and optimization, including:
adoption and optimization analysis; routine performance reporting; reporting of
summary information to management in order to drive effective decision making;
preparation and delivery of executive level reporting/dashboarding on key
objectives; ad-hoc reporting requests.
 
The individual
will also functionally manage offshore and outsource resource delivering S2P
support and execution, including input to performance management and
development.
 
This role has a
global impact across BNY Mellon, and will require collaboration with
stakeholders across many Business lines and Business Partner Groups as well as
external parties (e.g. vendors), therefore strong relationship management
skills are required. Management of change and implementation of initiatives will
be key, and the ability to understand the impact of change at the
organizational level and regulatory requirements are a core requirement. Where
issues fall outside the direct scope of eProcurement, the individual must be
able to influence and work collaboratively with wider stakeholders. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education
and work experience required; 5-7 years of total work experience preferred;
knowledge of procurement practices and ERP required. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. well as review of compliance/accounting for certain other  European entities. This is in respect of

playerDriving execution

advisor (Steuerberater).Extensive experience (minimum of 5

preferably working for a US multi-national financial services group Experience and knowledge of

Responsible for the ongoing, independent oversight of complex business continuity compliance activities and recovery management governance for an assigned function and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other risks. Advises and assists the assigned function with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Plans for both standard and non-standard business continuity risks and appropriately directs the function's activities to address any control gaps. Supports the business line managers via the cross company Business Recovery Coordinator network to ensure the company is meeting both client and regulatory requirements related to Business Continuity. This includes providing training and awareness on required deliverables, tracking and monitoring for completion, conducting quality assurance reviews and reporting back to management, as required. Directs the assigned function's identification of risks to functional resilience and completion of test recoveries and relocations as required by all applicable regulators and legal entities. Advises the function on the completion of responsibilities in relation to required test recoveries and relocations and develops projects and programs to improve compliance. May complete similar tasks for vendor continuity. Contributes to the evaluation of testing protocols each year in response to personnel changes, among others. Consistently directs cross-functional efforts to promote a strong Business Continuity & Recovery culture throughout the organization. Directly contributes to the drafting of the master resolution and recovery playbook for the organization, including documenting actions to be taken in the event of a crisis or bankruptcy. Uses growing knowledge of industry best practices to anticipate critiques from regulators. Meets with existing clients on an ongoing basis. Uses longstanding, strong working relationships with existing clients to ensure the completion of business continuity compliance activities when clients are in the process of purchasing new services or conducting due diligence required by their vendors. Assigns compliance activities to more junior professionals. Escalates significant business continuity issues to the Business Continuity Executive Committee. Helps to determine whether the risks associated with a client contract are tolerable for the organization. No direct reports; provides guidance to more junior team members and may assign tasks, as needed. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 10-12 years of total work experience preferred. The Regulatory Reporting Production team is the largest team within the EMEA Finance Professional Services Centre responsible for producing internal and external regulatory reporting returns across multiple EMEA locations. 
   
 Job Purpose/ Responsibilities (What the job role involves)
 


 Production of EMEA external regulatory, statistical and liquidity returns within prescribed regulatory deadlines.  These reporting deadlines have frequencies of daily, monthly, quarterly, half yearly, yearly and ad hoc 

 Production of internal regulatory reporting for business management and decision making.  

 Work in a strong operational control environment for data production and reporting e.g. certification, analytical review and checklists are carried out to the required level.  Adherence to regulatory governance policies 

 Work with other functional and business areas e.g. Treasury, Risk, Compliance, Legal and Business line management in the production of regulatory returns.  

 Projects to support the business in its objectives as regards to regulatory reporting and compliance with new regulatory rules and advisory work on business changes and restructures. 

 Provide support, advice and education to the business and business partners departments on the impact of new business and new regulatory rules 

 Other: Stay abreast of legislative and regulatory developments, as well as maintain their knowledge of External Reporting requirements and procedures.  Perform other functions as required from time-to-time. 
 
Requirements; (what we are looking for)
 


 Newly qualified accountant or qualified through experience 

 Regulatory reporting experience preferable  

 Deadline driven with a strong attention to detail 

 Experience of a fast moving, complex, highly controlled, multi-national/ functional organization 

 Analytical with an inquisitive/challenging mind set 

 Controls experience essential 

 Significant experience of accounting systems and processes (e.g. strong user of excel) 
 Data analytical experience desirable. #LI-KB1  Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater Manchester-Manchester Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 32218 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1818769

column2: Sr. Group Mgr, Third Party Governance (TPG)
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Manager for Third Party Governance Policies manages a team that is responsible for creating and maintaining Third Party Governance policies, procedures, guidelines, SLAs, and training that comply with US and regional regulations. The Manager would need to build the team by hiring high performing staff. This is a highly visible role and the Manager will need to work closely with senior executives across the company. 
 Primary Responsibilities Include:  
   
 Third Party Governance Policies:


 Create and maintain in an evergreen fashion a comprehensive set of Third Party Governance policies  

 Work with Legal and Compliance teams to ensure that the policies comply with the US and regional regulations 

 Work with Procurement, Corporate data and Security teams to ensure that the policies are optimized and not overlapping 

 Obtain necessary approvals or no-objections from Risk and other lines of defenses for the policies 

 Publish the policies and train the stakeholders on a periodic basis 
Third Party Procedures, Guidelines, and SLAs:


 Whenever a policy is revised or a new policy is created, work with Third Party Governance teams to create and implement detailed operating procedures, guidelines and SLAs 

 Assess the effectiveness of the procedures on an annual basis and make improvements as necessary 

 Be responsible for the Third Party Governance Risk Control Self Assessment (RCSA) and associated action items  
Staff Development:


 Build the team by hiring high performing staff 

 Direct, motivate, and develop staff  

 Responsible for employee satisfaction and performance management of the team 
Communications:


 Proactively communicate the upcoming changes to stakeholders 

 Develop close relationships with key stakeholders across Compliance, Legal, Risk, and Audit teams and keep them informed of emerging changes 
 Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and is not afraid of hard work and long hours (when needed) and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities.   Qualifications 

 12 – 15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience preferred 

 1-3 years of experience managing teams, with a track record of promoting team members is preferred 

 1-3 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Procurement, Strategy, Management Consulting, Compliance, Legal, Audit, Risk, Policies/Procedures areas is preferred 

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience is required 

 MBA from a top institute is preferred, but not required 

 Management consulting experience is preferred, but not required 

 Process optimization experience is preferred, but not required 

 Military experience is preferred, but not required  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. Accountable for establishing and maintaining the global vendor or interaffiliate-TPG framework. Drives change management processes to achieve outsourcing management consistency and global operating efficiency and embed an effective global risk management culture while meeting all regulatory and legal requirements. Interprets regulatory changes and enforces their implementation in a way that achieves results while satisfying the requirements of relevant regulators. Holds management accountable for regulatory compliance and the delivery of products and services from third party vendors and through interaffiliate relationships. Is accountable for developing consistent and robust processes to sustain compliance with global regulatory and legal requirements, providing transparency and comfort to all lines of business and the Executive board and ensuring continued high levels of service delivery. Defines the global strategy and direction for vendor and interaffiliate governance, control and risk. Leads the initial and ongoing development of the TPG global framework with a focus on all global regulatory requirements. Directs the development of materials from regulatory guidelines into workable and measureable global training and support solutions. Advises on and delivers vendor and interaffiliate-focused solutions to TPG requirements using significant industry expertise. Regularly engages with regulators and executive level stakeholders to understand requirements and drive global compliance. Advises senior and executive stakeholders on methods of ensuring compliance. Ensures regulatory requirements and quality standards across the global vendor and interaffiliate population. Maintains a worldwide overview of all interactions with relevant regulators on all outsourcing matters relevant to the vendor and interaffiliate population in coordination with senior management, the Legal Department and Compliance. Ensures appropriate and up to date contractual documentation exists and is accessible. Scopes and owns the development of strategies for the efficient implementation of global TPG policies, processes and systems. Establishes standards for day to day interactions with functional stakeholders including Legal, Compliance and Risk to ensure TPG processes are maintained to a standard that is acceptable to regulators. Leads regular meetings to assess the quality of the global TPG framework delivery and discuss any other relevant topics in relation to the outsourced services with senior level TPG group members, sponsors, stakeholders and vendors. Ensures more junior professional staff are managing vendor and interaffiliate relationships in scope with appropriate measurement and management tools and other related documentation. Designs and enforces a consistent approach to BAU outsourcing management worldwide and across legal entities. Communicates robust global metrics and reporting on outsourcing activity to senior management. Ensures appropriate changes to regulatory requirements are identified and responses and new ways of working are developed to maintain a positive control on global regulatory governance. Drives the design and implementation of an information repository to hold all completed outsourcing documentation. Uses existing strong strategic relationships with all key stakeholders such as Business and Legal Entity Managers and all key stakeholders and vendors to produce favorable conditions for TPG and ensure global regulatory compliance. Works closely with senior contacts within the TPG group in order to present a single client face to global customers. No direct reports. Leads more junior staff. Contributes to the achievement of global objectives and fulfillment of local and regional accountabilities. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. 10-12 years of total work experience preferred. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. The Legal Entity Controllers are responsible for the accounting of a number of German (DE) legal entities. The Operational Accountant will report to our Legal Entity Controllers and support the accounting process in performing certain Operational Accounting activities in accordance with deadlines and ensuring that the integrity of the financial control environment is maintained at all times.
 
The primary functions will include, but may not be limited to, the following:
 


 Overall responsibility for the Accounts Payable process, executed in Service Centers outside of Germany. Ensure that invoices are processed and paid within the payment terms. Monitor, action and escalate issues related to the Global Delivery Centers for the AP and T&E process. 

 Responsibility for the appropriate recognition of expenses in the financial statements. 

 Liaise with external vendors, external and internal clients. 

 Manage the relationship with cost center owners with regards to expense approvals and cost center allocation. 

 Assist the Legal Entity Controllers month-end close process, ensuring deadlines are achieved and the financial accounts are closed in a timely and accurate manner, in accordance with corporate requirements. 

 Produce and process the inter-company invoicing and to assist in the inter-company confirmation, elimination and resolution process. 

 Cash management of corporate bank accounts and posting cash transactions to the general ledger on a timely basis. 

 Governance and oversight of offshored processes to Global Delivery Centers and to monitor, action and escalate issues thereto related. 
  Qualifications Qualifications:


 A minimum of 3 years of experience in an Accounting Team. 

 Qualified accountant (Bilanzbuchhalter/in) or equivalent qualification / education (DE GAAP exposure is an advantage). 

 Exposure to working with general ledger systems preferably PeopleSoft and related reporting tools. 

 Good PC skills essential, in particular Excel. 

 Sound expertise in German VAT related topics. 

 Good communication and interpersonal skills as well as proven decision making and being responsible and accountable. 

 Deadline driven with effective time management and ability to work under pressure and attention to detail. 

 Client orientated and results focused. 

 Able to manage risk in a highly regulated and controlled environment. 

 Highly motivated, fast learning and proactive with an ability for problem solving. 

 German native speaker. 

 Very good English language skills.  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: Germany-Hessen-Frankfurt Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85082 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1818090

column2: Third Party Governance (TPG) – Third Party Oversight Sr. Specialist
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) -　Third Party Oversight Senior Specialist works directly for the Head of Third Party Administration and Oversight and helps manage projects, emerging issues, and executive meetings. This is a highly visible role and the Senior Specialist will need to work closely with senior executives across the company.
Primary Responsibilities Include: 
　
Manage any assigned Third Party Oversight related strategy, compliance and control projects: 
 
* Determine the scope, resources, timelines
* Obtain approval for the project
* Create project plans, and 
* Execute and report on project
　
Manage any assigned Third Party Oversight related emerging issues
 
* Determine the stakeholders and identify the root causes
* Determine options to solve the issue
* Obtain approvals for plan of action
* Execute on the plan of action　
 
Manage Third Party Administration and Oversight Executive Meetings and updates
 
* Lead the monthly business review with senior executives


Working with group managers, prepare the business review deck
Manage the follow-up tasks list
Ensure that nothing is dropped
* Produce weekly group performance report that goes to senior executives 
* Help the Head of Third Party Administration and Oversight manage the group budget　　
 
Assist in Third Party Oversight Staff Development:
 
* Assist the Head of Third Party Administration and Oversight in keeping the group employee satisfaction high 
* Manage the weekly staff meetings and follow-up action items
* Help produce weekly group newsletter to employees
* Manage the monthly learning and collaboration sessions to keep the group informed of changes
* Arrange for senior executives to have coffee chats, lunch meetings, and other meet & greet sessions with employees; manage group townhalls
* Manage the monthly group employee survey to determine employee hot spots and take actions to resolve those hot spots
 
* Communications:
 
* Develop close relationships with employees in the group
* Be the conduit for group employees to share their feedback with senior executives
 
This will be an ideal role for an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and is not afraid of hard work and long hours (when needed) and views this role as a proving ground for promotional opportunities. Qualifications
Qualifications:
 
* 7-10 years of total work experience is preferred
* 1-3 years of Strategy or Management Consulting experience is strongly preferred
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience is required
* MBA from a top institute is strongly preferred
* Outstanding PowerPoint skills and strong Excel skills are required
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills are required
* Process optimization experience is preferred, but not required
* Project management experience is preferred, but not required

column4:
The Regulatory Accountant role within the BNY Mellon Capital Markets Controllers group provides accounting and financial reporting support for all BNY Mellon Capital Markets activities.  BNY Mellon Capital Markets, LLC is a registered broker-dealer with the SEC and is a member of FINRA.  The Company’s businesses include securities underwriting, distribution, and trading.　 The individual will participate in preparing accounting entries, financial statements, and parent company reporting. Responsibilities of the individual will also include ensuring adequate controls are in place, preparing P&L reports, performing price validation procedures, and preparing various regulatory filings.　 This individual will interface with many areas including front office, operations, technology, and audit groups.
　
The candidate will support end to end accounting processes and complete research required to transform data into information for reporting purposes. Activities may include processing standard general ledger events and transactions, assisting with continuous improvement activities such as the identification and analysis of exceptions, providing support for audits, completing assignments to support the maintenance of the control environment, in accordance with global, regional and country-specific process standards and completing process improvements. 
　
Duties include the responsibility for creating and posting journal entries to the general ledger accounts in an accurate, complete and timely manner. With little guidance, performs reconciliations of general ledger accounts or other financial data. Identifies and escalates issues, as needed. Reviews and/or approves journal entries and/or reconciliations completed by less experienced professionals. Performance of monthly reconciliations for general ledger accounts assigned to candidate. Provide support work papers as part of audits, fulfilling ad hoc requests and regular review and improvement of procedures. May deliver recommendations for use in accounting and financial reporting to senior management and the internal board of directors. May complete special project activities, as assigned. 
　
Responsible for identifying and reporting risks, patterns or recurring issues and working with all necessary parties and technical teams to reach a resolution. 
　
No direct reports. May review work completed by less experienced staff including overseas staff. 
　
Contributes to the achievement of the assigned line of business, legal entity or entities, country, region or accounting process' objectives.  Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. Accounting concentration preferred. MBA or CPA/CA/local area equivalent certification preferred. 
　
Preferred Experience: 5-7 years of total work experience preferred with a minimum 2-3 years investment banking accounting experience. Knowledge of GAAP and accounting and finance concepts and analysis techniques preferred. Experience in investment banking accounting and accounting processes strongly preferred. Investment Bank accounting skills including product control and stock brokerage general accounting.　 Experience with SEC X-17a-5 FOCUS reports including securities haircuts (experience with Len Bole fixed income and risk based haircuts preferred), net capital and reserve computations under SEC Rules 15c3-1 and 15c3-3 is highly preferred. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Populate non-automated pricing templates for simple products under the guidance of more senior staff. No direct reports. column2: Sr. Group Mgr, Third Party Governance (TPG)
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Manager for Third Party Governance Policies manages a team that is responsible for creating and maintaining Third Party Governance policies, procedures, guidelines, SLAs, and training that comply with US and regional regulations. The Manager would need to build the team by hiring high performing staff. This is a highly visible role and the Manager will need to work closely with senior executives across the company. 
 Primary Responsibilities Include:  
   
 Third Party Governance Policies:


 Create and maintain in an evergreen fashion a comprehensive set of Third Party Governance policies  

 Work with Legal and Compliance teams to ensure that the policies comply with the US and regional regulations 

 Work with Procurement, Corporate data and Security teams to ensure that the policies are optimized and not overlapping 

 Obtain necessary approvals or no-objections from Risk and other lines of defenses for the policies 

 Publish the policies and train the stakeholders on a periodic basis 
Third Party Procedures, Guidelines, and SLAs:


 Whenever a policy is revised or a new policy is created, work with Third Party Governance teams to create and implement detailed operating procedures, guidelines and SLAs 

 Assess the effectiveness of the procedures on an annual basis and make improvements as necessary 

 Be responsible for the Third Party Governance Risk Control Self Assessment (RCSA) and associated action items  
Staff Development:


 Build the team by hiring high performing staff 

 Direct, motivate, and develop staff  

 Responsible for employee satisfaction and performance management of the team 
Communications:


 Proactively communicate the upcoming changes to stakeholders 

 Develop close relationships with key stakeholders across Compliance, Legal, Risk, and Audit teams and keep them informed of emerging changes 
 Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and is not afraid of hard work and long hours (when needed) and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities.   Qualifications 

 12 – 15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience preferred 

 1-3 years of experience managing teams, with a track record of promoting team members is preferred 

 1-3 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Procurement, Strategy, Management Consulting, Compliance, Legal, Audit, Risk, Policies/Procedures areas is preferred 

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience is required 

 MBA from a top institute is preferred, but not required 

 Management consulting experience is preferred, but not required 

 Process optimization experience is preferred, but not required 

 Military experience is preferred, but not required  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. Fund/Client Accounting - IC3 Conducts accounting services on behalf of assigned clients and moderately complex funds including determining net asset values, calculating fund performance, allocating expenses and preparing reports. Performs complex Fund/Client Accounting responsibilities in the areas of driving Service Improvement plans, targeting efficiencies, enhancing processes and specialist review functions. Provides input into methodologies and checks the work of more junior team members. Provides guidance and reviews work related to cash and asset reconciliations relating to complex accounts or transactions. Resolves reconciliation of accounts for more complex or atypical transactions and reviews work of junior team members. Drafts reports for clients regarding the performance of complex funds. Reviews draft reports completed by more junior staff. Regularly interacts with clients in answering questions and resolving issues regarding fund reports and accounting processes. Assists in evaluating GAAP and/or IFRS rules to determine impact of new regulations on BNY Mellon fund accounting practices. No direct reports. Provides guidance to less experienced team members. May have people management responsibilities in some geographies. Contributes to the achievement of related teams objectives.    Qualifications Bachelors degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Big 4 accounting firm experience preferred.   Key duties of the role include; Plan, coordinate and track
filing processes for Form PF, AIFMD Annex IV, and CPO-PQR. Collect data from
internal and external parties. Normalize and scrub data. Enrich data and
perform data prep calculations. Provide regulatory calculations, aggregations
and final reporting to the client for review and approval.     Preferred Qualifications:   Familiarity with financial markets and instruments and accounting practices. Strong analytical problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and make recommendations to improve workflow and service level. Ability to identify data and/or reporting discrepancies and analyze the impact of new and evolving financial instruments and market conditions with respect to reporting requirements related to Form PF, AIFMD, and CPO-PQR. Detail oriented and proven ability to assimilate new information quickly. Ability to provide efficient and accurate verbal and written analysis. Strong verbal, communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work cooperatively with all levels of staff and management.Manage multiple tasks independently, while consistently providing high quality and timely products. Strong proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, sumifs).  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. The Legal Entity Controllers are responsible for the accounting of a number of German (DE) legal entities. The Operational Accountant will report to our Legal Entity Controllers and support the accounting process in performing certain Operational Accounting activities in accordance with deadlines and ensuring that the integrity of the financial control environment is maintained at all times.
 
The primary functions will include, but may not be limited to, the following:
 


 Overall responsibility for the Accounts Payable process, executed in Service Centers outside of Germany. Ensure that invoices are processed and paid within the payment terms. Monitor, action and escalate issues related to the Global Delivery Centers for the AP and T&E process. 

 Responsibility for the appropriate recognition of expenses in the financial statements. 

 Liaise with external vendors, external and internal clients. 

 Manage the relationship with cost center owners with regards to expense approvals and cost center allocation. 

 Assist the Legal Entity Controllers month-end close process, ensuring deadlines are achieved and the financial accounts are closed in a timely and accurate manner, in accordance with corporate requirements. 

 Produce and process the inter-company invoicing and to assist in the inter-company confirmation, elimination and resolution process. 

 Cash management of corporate bank accounts and posting cash transactions to the general ledger on a timely basis. 

 Governance and oversight of offshored processes to Global Delivery Centers and to monitor, action and escalate issues thereto related. 
  Qualifications Qualifications:


 A minimum of 3 years of experience in an Accounting Team. 

 Qualified accountant (Bilanzbuchhalter/in) or equivalent qualification / education (DE GAAP exposure is an advantage). 

 Exposure to working with general ledger systems preferably PeopleSoft and related reporting tools. 

 Good PC skills essential, in particular Excel. 

 Sound expertise in German VAT related topics. 

 Good communication and interpersonal skills as well as proven decision making and being responsible and accountable. 

 Deadline driven with effective time management and ability to work under pressure and attention to detail. 

 Client orientated and results focused. 

 Able to manage risk in a highly regulated and controlled environment. 

 Highly motivated, fast learning and proactive with an ability for problem solving. 

 German native speaker. 

 Very good English language skills.  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: Germany-Hessen-Frankfurt Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85082 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1818090

column2: Third Party Governance (TPG) – Third Party Oversight Sr. Specialist
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) -　Third Party Oversight Senior Specialist works directly for the Head of Third Party Administration and Oversight and helps manage projects, emerging issues, and executive meetings. This is a highly visible role and the Senior Specialist will need to work closely with senior executives across the company.
Primary Responsibilities Include: 
　
Manage any assigned Third Party Oversight related strategy, compliance and control projects: 
 
* Determine the scope, resources, timelines
* Obtain approval for the project
* Create project plans, and 
* Execute and report on project
　
Manage any assigned Third Party Oversight related emerging issues
 
* Determine the stakeholders and identify the root causes
* Determine options to solve the issue
* Obtain approvals for plan of action
* Execute on the plan of action　
 
Manage Third Party Administration and Oversight Executive Meetings and updates
 
* Lead the monthly business review with senior executives


Working with group managers, prepare the business review deck
Manage the follow-up tasks list
Ensure that nothing is dropped
* Produce weekly group performance report that goes to senior executives 
* Help the Head of Third Party Administration and Oversight manage the group budget　　
 
Assist in Third Party Oversight Staff Development:
 
* Assist the Head of Third Party Administration and Oversight in keeping the group employee satisfaction high 
* Manage the weekly staff meetings and follow-up action items
* Help produce weekly group newsletter to employees
* Manage the monthly learning and collaboration sessions to keep the group informed of changes
* Arrange for senior executives to have coffee chats, lunch meetings, and other meet & greet sessions with employees; manage group townhalls
* Manage the monthly group employee survey to determine employee hot spots and take actions to resolve those hot spots
 
* Communications:
 
* Develop close relationships with employees in the group
* Be the conduit for group employees to share their feedback with senior executives
 
This will be an ideal role for an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and is not afraid of hard work and long hours (when needed) and views this role as a proving ground for promotional opportunities. Qualifications
Qualifications:
 
* 7-10 years of total work experience is preferred
* 1-3 years of Strategy or Management Consulting experience is strongly preferred
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience is required
* MBA from a top institute is strongly preferred
* Outstanding PowerPoint skills and strong Excel skills are required
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills are required
* Process optimization experience is preferred, but not required
* Project management experience is preferred, but not required

The Regulatory Accountant role within the BNY Mellon Capital Markets Controllers group provides accounting and financial reporting support for all BNY Mellon Capital Markets activities.  BNY Mellon Capital Markets, LLC is a registered broker-dealer with the SEC and is a member of FINRA.  The Company’s businesses include securities underwriting, distribution, and trading.　 The individual will participate in preparing accounting entries, financial statements, and parent company reporting. Responsibilities of the individual will also include ensuring adequate controls are in place, preparing P&L reports, performing price validation procedures, and preparing various regulatory filings.　 This individual will interface with many areas including front office, operations, technology, and audit groups.
　
The candidate will support end to end accounting processes and complete research required to transform data into information for reporting purposes. Activities may include processing standard general ledger events and transactions, assisting with continuous improvement activities such as the identification and analysis of exceptions, providing support for audits, completing assignments to support the maintenance of the control environment, in accordance with global, regional and country-specific process standards and completing process improvements. 
　
Duties include the responsibility for creating and posting journal entries to the general ledger accounts in an accurate, complete and timely manner. With little guidance, performs reconciliations of general ledger accounts or other financial data. Identifies and escalates issues, as needed. Reviews and/or approves journal entries and/or reconciliations completed by less experienced professionals. Performance of monthly reconciliations for general ledger accounts assigned to candidate. Provide support work papers as part of audits, fulfilling ad hoc requests and regular review and improvement of procedures. May deliver recommendations for use in accounting and financial reporting to senior management and the internal board of directors. May complete special project activities, as assigned. 
　
Responsible for identifying and reporting risks, patterns or recurring issues and working with all necessary parties and technical teams to reach a resolution. 
　
No direct reports. May review work completed by less experienced staff including overseas staff. 
　
Contributes to the achievement of the assigned line of business, legal entity or entities, country, region or accounting process' objectives.  Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. Accounting concentration preferred. MBA or CPA/CA/local area equivalent certification preferred. 
　
Preferred Experience: 5-7 years of total work experience preferred with a minimum 2-3 years investment banking accounting experience. Knowledge of GAAP and accounting and finance concepts and analysis techniques preferred. Experience in investment banking accounting and accounting processes strongly preferred. Investment Bank accounting skills including product control and stock brokerage general accounting.　 Experience with SEC X-17a-5 FOCUS reports including securities haircuts (experience with Len Bole fixed income and risk based haircuts preferred), net capital and reserve computations under SEC Rules 15c3-1 and 15c3-3 is highly preferred. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Responds to basic queries from Billing and other internal teams on pricing questions. May work with external clients to clarify and resolve Billing questions tied to pricing schedules. Populate non-automated pricing templates for simple products under the guidance of more senior staff. No direct reports. Responsible for less complex products and clients and contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 0-3 years of total work experience preferred. Fund/Client Accounting - IC3 Conducts accounting services on behalf of assigned clients and moderately complex funds including determining net asset values, calculating fund performance, allocating expenses and preparing reports. Performs complex Fund/Client Accounting responsibilities in the areas of driving Service Improvement plans, targeting efficiencies, enhancing processes and specialist review functions. Provides input into methodologies and checks the work of more junior team members. Provides guidance and reviews work related to cash and asset reconciliations relating to complex accounts or transactions. Resolves reconciliation of accounts for more complex or atypical transactions and reviews work of junior team members. Drafts reports for clients regarding the performance of complex funds. Reviews draft reports completed by more junior staff. Regularly interacts with clients in answering questions and resolving issues regarding fund reports and accounting processes. Assists in evaluating GAAP and/or IFRS rules to determine impact of new regulations on BNY Mellon fund accounting practices. No direct reports. Provides guidance to less experienced team members. May have people management responsibilities in some geographies. Contributes to the achievement of related teams objectives.    Qualifications Bachelors degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Big 4 accounting firm experience preferred.   Key duties of the role include; Plan, coordinate and track
filing processes for Form PF, AIFMD Annex IV, and CPO-PQR. Collect data from
internal and external parties. Normalize and scrub data. Enrich data and
perform data prep calculations. Provide regulatory calculations, aggregations
and final reporting to the client for review and approval.     Preferred Qualifications:   Familiarity with financial markets and instruments and accounting practices. Strong analytical problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and make recommendations to improve workflow and service level. Ability to identify data and/or reporting discrepancies and analyze the impact of new and evolving financial instruments and market conditions with respect to reporting requirements related to Form PF, AIFMD, and CPO-PQR. Detail oriented and proven ability to assimilate new information quickly. Ability to provide efficient and accurate verbal and written analysis. Strong verbal, communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work cooperatively with all levels of staff and management.Manage multiple tasks independently, while consistently providing high quality and timely products. Strong proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, sumifs).  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. As the strategy and analytics team leader, you will be responsible for accelerating, innovating, and improving productivity for our clients, products, and employees.
 
In addition to execution, this group partners across the bank to refine strategic efficiency priorities (e.g. automation strategy, BNYM role as a key contributor to the US financial market infrastructure etc.). You will work with both the Operations and Finance leadership teams to assess complex business and process issues, identify actionable opportunities for improvement, and quantify bottom line financial impact of recommendations. The lead will:


Oversee multiple projects, each of which have discrete problem-solving workstreams for which you will ultimately be responsible for delivering results
Serve variously as an individual strategic advisor, a project lead, or enlisting a full team from one of the supporting businesses we are engaged with, depending on need
Advise on, or assist in creating, metrics needed to measure overall improvement
Set overall Operations strategy (3-5 year view), conceiving and proposing initiatives against the strategy, and aligning teams and work plans to execute
Facilitate leadership discussions and investigatory interviews  
Structure and analyze various data sources to build a basis for decision making
Syndicate recommendations and advocate for appropriate funding for strategic priorities
Manage team of 3-5 associate/analysts Qualifications 
BS/BA required
10-15 years of overall experience preferred, with 3-5+ years consulting experience with a management consulting firm or an internal consulting function preferred
Experience in process improvement, particularly within an operations environment
Ability to effectively prioritize multiple projects and tasks
Proficient in Excel, Powerpoint  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
