The IS will provide insight and guidance for insurance policy coverage conditions and premium renewals .The individual will work independently to accomplish his/her own assigned workload and collaborate with other members of the group to ensure compliance with approved insurance industry standards. This individual will be expected to provide back up support and at times represent the Insurance Manager. The Senior Specialist, External Reporting works with senior management roles to ensure that the appropriate external reporting policies, methods, standards, processes, reporting and training are developed, applied and understood by impacted stakeholders. He/she has extensive knowledge of regulatory reporting processes and in-depth knowledge of compliance in regulatory bodies. 
 
The role will be in contact with various stakeholders from regional (Manchester) and global (Chennai) finance delivery center, finance management, external auditors and regulators. He/she will report directly to the Head of Regulatory, consolidation and statutory reporting for BNYM SANV. He will work in collaboration within a team of dedicated more experienced SME’s having similar responsibilities.
 
This role will be responsible for second review and oversight of production done out of Regional Service center for dedicated European (Pillar III, SHS…) and Belgian reports (Schema A, statistics…). This include verification of the work performed, controls of accuracy, completeness, compliance with high quality standard expected from stakeholders and making sure submission is done within required timeline including escalation of issues to the local management. 
 
This role will ensure completeness of proper description of control environment through maintenance of proper ICRR and documentation.  He/she will be help with support to internal audit, sox and external audit reviews. He/she will also be responsible to supervise or prepare response to adhoc queries from different regulators. 
 
The role will act as a Subject Matter expert to the dedicated reporting and will take care in collaboration with experienced colleagues of preparation of matters of interpretation in regards to the reporting regulation. He/she will also be engaged in different project to implement new requirements, new reporting on assess the impact of On-Boarding of new products on his/her dedicated reporting.
 
The role will work in collaboration with other finance stakeholders including LE controllers to improve regulatory reporting processes. 
 
Responsibilities within Brussels Finance:
 
1.       Review of Dedicated European and Belgian reporting :
 
Responsible of review of dedicated European or Belgian regulatory reporting: This include verification of the work performed by the regional delivery center, controls of accuracy, completeness, compliance with high quality standard expected from stakeholders and making sure submission is done within required timeline including escalation of issues to the local management. This includes the performance and evidence of control for management review and explanation of results to management through dedicated review meetings.
 
2.       Handling of Ad-hoc regulatory request :
 
Preparation or supervision of answers to dedicated adhoc regulatory request.
 
3.       Subject Matter Expert : 
 
He/she will take care of preparation of first draft with experienced colleagues of matters of interpretation in regards to the reporting regulation. He/she will also be engaged in different project to implement new requirements, new reporting on assess the impact of On-Boarding of new products on his/her dedicated reporting.
 
4.       Support with Audit : 
 
He/she will provide support to internal audit, Sox and external audit in their review of SANV processes.
 
5.       Follow up of regulatory development : 
 
He/she will monitor regulatory changes to his/her dedicated reporting requirements. He/she will analyse evolution to ensure the driving of relevant changes into the processes of the bank. 
  Qualifications ·        Education: University Degree in Economics, Engineering or Business Accounting qualification or equivalent
·        Experience: Over 3 years of relevant experience in European (CRD4, EBA, Pillar3 or SRB reporting) or Belgian reporting (Schema A, Statistics). Experience towards statutory reporting (IFRS FS, Schema B) is a plus 
·        Good communication skills able to adapt to the audience.
·        Great Team spirit able foster collaboration with people located outside of his group/location.
·        Language Skills: English/French or English/Dutch BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: Belgium-Brussels-Capital Region-Brussels Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85077 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1816169

column2: UK Finance Controls and Governance Analyst
column4:
Job Purpose: 
 As a Controls Analyst within the UK Controllers group you will support management in ensuring a robust, fit for purpose control environment for accounting, statutory and regulatory reporting. You will assist the team in ensuring that risks are identified, the key controls mitigating the risks are operating effectively and that there is accountability for managing them.   
 UK Controllers have outsourced core production activities to specialist service centres in Manchester and India.  You will work with these operational groups, updating the control metrics to clearly demonstrate our oversight of these activities. You will contribute to reporting for the Senior Stakeholders on a regular basis on key performance metrics associated with accounting and financial reporting controls.   
 You will also contribute to key controls processes such as disaster recovery coordination, banking administration and records management, working across UK finance to deliver programme requirements.  
 You should be willing to bring ideas to the table, and be able to communicate effectively with staff at a range of different levels. You should ideally have previous controls experience in a global environment. 
 Key responsibilities:
Governance


 Updating governance and controls framework documentation, working to deadlines and demonstrating compliance on request.  

 Assist in identifying process enhancements that will both strengthen the control environment and improve operational efficiency. 

 Monitor reported control issues, following up with responsible parties and escalating issues when appropriate. 

 The role will require you to build relationships across the Finance teams, service providers and external stakeholders. 
 
Reporting


 Contribute to reporting on programmes such as Operational Risk Events and Key Risk and Control Indicators.   

 Assist in co-ordination of monthly meetings with the specialist service centres, reviewing KPIs and other metrics to measure their effectiveness. 
 
Procedures & Compliance


 Work with the Controls team monitoring outsourced control activities, including banking administration, IMMS internal account population and ownership controls, MI reporting and reconciliation Quality Analysis. 

 Assist in maintaining and monitoring the control framework for records management for UK finance. 

 Help to maintain Senior Management Regime control documentation. 

 Assist in collation of quarter end attestation reporting. 

 Coordinate updates of Business Recovery documentation and changes to Banking system access. 
 
Person Specification/ Qualifications:


 Risk or controls specialist looking for hands on role. 

 Financial services experience and / or experience of large global organization preferred.  

 Risk management, controls and governance experience. 

 Project and outsourcing experiences would be desirable. 

 Excellent computer skills, in particular MS Power point and MS Excel. 

 Exposure to PeopleSoft general ledgers desirable, but not required. 
 
Core Competencies: 


 Good communicator 

 Ability to collaborate across teams, both within Finance and the wider organisation 

 Able to work in a complex global organisation 

 Be accountable for your deliverables    Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater Manchester-Manchester Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85083 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1817007

column2: Sr. Group Manager, Third Party Governance
column4:
The Senior Group Manager, Third Party Governance will report into the Head of Third Party Oversight and Administration and will help in building and managing a high performance and regulatory compliant Third Party Risk Assessment process across First Line of Defense domains in the enterprise. The job is a highly visible role and successful candidate will need to work closely with senior executives, including "C" level executives across the company. 
　
Primary Responsibilities Include: 
 
Creation of the process: Work with the consulting team that is helping establish Third Party Risk Assessment Methodology across the enterprise:


Work with various First Line of Defense Risk domains and establish a regulatory compliant risk assessment framework 
Help establish risk rules, risk appetite, set of mitigating controls, risk indicators, and recommended ongoing monitoring measures for each domain 
 
Creation of the system:Act as a key point-of-contact for the Systems team that is building a new enterprise wide Third Party Governance tool:


Work with the Systems team in developing the business requirements for all domains 
The new system business requirements should operationalize the risk assessment framework established in prior step
 
Operationalization of the system:
Once the Third Party Governance system is in place, help lead the effort to operationalizing the system 


Working with other stakeholders, help determine the operationalization sequence (sequence of groups that go to new system, timing, etc.) 
Lead the training, communication, and socialization aspects prior to the launch
Help in identifying, tracking, and resolving issues during the launch
BAU Risk Assessments and Ongoing MonitoringOnce the new system is implemented, establish and run an oversight process on the risk domains you are responsible for


Track and review the performance of each domain on a weekly basis for the domains 
Lead quarterly business reviews with each domain
Identify, track, and resolve any issues or roadblocks
Leadership Skills:


Working with domain owners, help build a strong, talented, resilient risk assessment teams across the enterprise
Responsible, along with domain owners, for the employee satisfaction scores of the risk assessment teams under each domain 
Communications:


Proactively communicate the progress and issues with stakeholders
Develop close relationships with key stakeholders across the company 
Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and is not afraid of hard work and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities. Given the exposure to many "C" level executives, this role will provide for bigger opportunities for successful candidates.  Qualifications * Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. 
* 12-15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience, preferred.
* Proven track record of managing and promoting team members is preferred.
* 3-5 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Procurement, Compliance, Legal, Audit, or Risk areas is preferred* MBA from a top institute is preferred, but not required* Management consulting experience is preferred, but not required* Operational experience is preferred, but not required* Project management experience is preferred, but not required * Process optimization experience is preferred, but not required* Technology experience is preferred, but not required
* Military experience is preferred, but not required

column2: Specialist, Travel & Expenses (Corporate Cards) Corporate Services
column4:
This position is responsible for the management of the Client Global Corporate Card & Purchasing Card program 
 The card program includes the issuance and cancelation of Corporate Travel (T&E) cards, maintenance of organizational hierarchy and production of management reporting, including managing any new implementations for new countries or new company acquisitions as appropriate. 
 Implementation of the purchasing card program to include strategy, vendor opportunity analysis, and training of cardholders. 
 This position proactively monitors spend for compliance to policy to minimize credit losses, and identify financial risk factors while working with stakeholders to resolve issues. 
 This role liaises with Shared Services / Expense Accounting to ensure policies and procedures are aligned, integration with Expense system is optimized and helpdesk teams are briefed to answer employee questions and cardholders receive appropriate support for escalation issues. 
 Responsible for documentation of procedures and communications to establish global standards to support implementation of best practices. 
 Issues exception/non-compliance reporting, management spend and supplier reporting to identify opportunity areas, manage vendor negotiations and to mitigate risk. 
 Responsible for creating communications and maintaining website information to assist cardholders to manage their accounts effectively and deliver customer service for our T&E, purchasing and meeting cardholders. 
 Ability to effectively manage and prioritize a heavy workload with completing priorities 
 Management presence; able to gain confidence and respect in skills, knowledge and ability with members of team as well as others within the organization at all levels 
 Outstanding people skills and ability to work effectively in a team based environment 
 Strong knowledge and understanding of travel industry.  
 Strong knowledge and understanding of commercial card programs. 
 No direct reports.  
 Job scope is typically limited to the quality and accuracy of own work.  
 Modified based upon local regulations/requirements.  
 Strong customer service, listening and communication skills 
 Demonstrated project management and leadership capability  
 Open minded – collaborator – willingness to think outside of the box 
 Ability to assess a situation objectively 
 Leverage travel spending to implement cost reduction/avoidance opportunities 
 Monitoring agreement usage and ensuring committed levels are maintained 
 Ensure organization’s travel objectives are met and travel policies are updated to align with travel industry trends and organizational needs  
 Monitor the performance of the travel management company and other travel suppliers to ensure quality and service levels 
 Identify trends, determine causes and develop and implement corrective action plans as appropriate 
 Communicate service and cost avoidance opportunities to employees 
 Build cross-functional partnerships and strategies to drive continuous program and process improvement and cost reductions 
 Day-to-day oversight and liaison with travel agency staff as well as travel suppliers (i.e. airlines, hotels, rental cars, ground transportation companies and corporate charge card provider)  
 Well rounded knowledge of the travel industry, technologies used for reservations systems and data collection 
 Requires a Bachelor's degree with emphasis in business or travel related subject matter.   Travel certification(s) such as CCTE preferred  
 Demonstrated written and verbal leadership skills and the ability to work independently and across functions are essential. Full working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel.  Must possess strong analytical, financial, oral and written communication skills.  Must be service oriented with exceptional interpersonal skills in order to communicate with all levels of company personnel and suppliers.  Must be skilled in problem solving, decision making and able to work against deadlines.  Knowledge of travel technology/e-commerce applications a plus.  Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. HedgeMark (“HM”), a BNY Mellon company, specializes in supporting institutional clients in the development and operation of their own private hedge fund dedicated managed account platforms (“DMA”).  HM supports clients information and structuring of their private vehicles, negotiating fund documents and counterparty agreements, and project managing each fund’s launch.  Post-launch, HM provides risk and performance reporting, transparency and investment guideline monitoring to the client.  HM is also responsible for performing operational and accounting functions which provide independent oversight and controls to the process.  

As of August 31, 2018, HM services 102 DMA funds with $11 Billion assets under management.  


The HedgeMark Onboarding Team is responsible for the following functions:

Project manage new client relationships, new fund launches and additional counterparty agreements
Lead introduction calls with new Investment Managers to explain HedgeMark’s managed account model and roles and responsibilities 
Work with structuring team to ensure all fund documents are negotiated and executed in a timely manner to meet project deadlines.
Take the lead on establishing counterparty trading agreements – take the lead in requesting new documentation from counterparties, ensuring drafts are received and negotiated (by the HedgeMark Structuring team or outside counsel), populating account opening forms, requesting daily reporting from counterparties from all relevant parties, and ensuring accounts are set up timely in order to launch new funds.
Serve as a point of contact for clients and investment manager queries.  Work with internal and external contacts to ensure queries are addressed in a timely manner.
The Junior Onboarder will work closely with Senior Onboarding staff in New York to support onboarding functions; in particular the process of counterparty agreements and account opening documentation.

Duties Include:

Support the Fund Structuring and Onboarding teams on new Hedge Fund structures.
Request documentation from counterparties and assist lead onboarder with meeting counterparty documentation requirements.
Documentation administration – assist with all counterparty account openings. Complete documentation, liaise with Fund governance provider for execution and update all relevant parties. 
Track status of all counterparty documentation and project plan items, and update internal systems with all statuses.
Follow up with counterparties on document and account opening status.
Ensure proper file maintenance. 
Keep meeting notes and update onboarding status. 
Interface with service providers including Administrators, Counterparties, Legal counsel etc. 
Special Projects

 Qualifications Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience in business management or related field is required. 
1-3 years of total work experience is strongly preferred in a project team and/or administrative role.
Ability to prioritize workload, provide project status updates and enter account application information in a timely fashion.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and excellent organizational skills are required.
Microsoft word and PDF document experience strongly preferred.
 
What we can offer you:

Full time contract of employment
Competitive salary
Health & Life Insurance
Multisport card / Cinema Tickets / Nursery subsidiary
Pension scheme
Excellent opportunities for training, growth and professional development
Opportunities to engage in diverse projects due to growth of business migrations
A multitude of opportunities to get involved in additional charity projects
A collaborative culture and great teams

column4:
Business Technology Liaison - IC3 
   Analyzes, defines and prioritizes business requirements and functional or operational specifications for moderate to large projects of increasing complexity. Provides consultation to all areas of IT and business management for the application of technology to support business opportunities and planning, implementation of cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project.

Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes business requirements. Translates into functional design and use case documents. Develops project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions. Plans and formulates aspects of development proposals including the objective or purpose of projects, existing applications that can be utilized, and equipment and human resource requirements.

Participates in and provides guidance on development of functional requirements and user documentation. Consults internal business groups on requirements, functional architecture and implementation.  Uses thorough knowledge of business needs to provide design support to software and application development teams.

Gathers and analyzes information to assist in the development of recommendations to address business objectives that span multiple business and technology areas. Works with business and technology teams to implement technology roadmap strategy.

Trains users on new or enhanced applications and/or systems of moderate complexity.  Serves as point of contact or subject matter expert for the business on specific systems.

Provides technical consultation concerning business implications of application development projects.  Supports testing of new or enhanced applications and/or systems and provides guidance to junior team members on case development, requirement traceability analysis, test preparation, script writing, and functional test execution.

Uses broad knowledge of regulatory and legal requirements and BNY Mellon corporate policies involving risk and control to support the development of improved business processes through technology.

No direct reports, provides guidance to less experienced colleagues. Leads projects and allocates work accordingly.

Contributes to the achievement of related teams objectives.    Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Technical experience and understanding of real estate operations/related concepts and/or strong accounting background preferred. 3+ years practical experience utilizing YARDI as a real estate accounting system for an owner, property management company, fund administrator or other investment service provider is strongly preferred (including but not limited to; set up, reporting and property management functions). Strongly preferred business knowledge of real estate as an investment, investment operations for property and fund administration functions, fund accounting/review preferable, and a strong knowledge of controls and procedures.  Business Analysis and Support Services (BASS) is a global team that operates in North America, Ireland, Poland and Germany and supports the different platforms and product lines within the Alternative Investment Services division. The main disciplines within the team are system support, project management and business analysis for Real Estate, Single manager, Private Equity and Fund of Funds.  The Analyst/support role involves supporting the Real Estate service delivery teams utilizing the Yardi platform to provide fund administration to real estate investment clients.  Key Responsibilities:Provide YARDI subject matter expertise and be the primary point of contact for "technical" advice and support to accounting and investor services users.Support Fund Accountants with the setup and design of Accounting Automation rules and with use of various Accounting and General Ledger Consolidation Methods such as Full Consolidation, Equity Method / Pickup, Minority Interest, NCI, etc.Support Fund Accountants with the setup, automation and tracking of various Cash and Income transactions that impact Investor Ledger, Capital Balances and related Cash Flows.Support Fund Accountants with the automation and reporting of Performance Returns including TWR, industry standard benchmarks such as NCREIF, IPD as well as ILPA / PERE reporting, etc.Assist in the preparation of Business Requirement Documents for systems enhancements and report enhancements/creation.Complete Quality Control testing for local user environment and be part of Quality Control global team.Participate in new client data conversions. Support the Client Servicing New business team. This will incorporate participation in project planning, assisting in the system set ups and user testing where applicable.Working with new and existing YARDI users to implement system developments and deliver training. Troubleshoot YARDI operational issues prior to referring to vendor for resolution.

column2: Sr. Specialist, External Reporting - Liquidity Regulatory Reporting (Vice President)
column4: Participates in managing the production and quality of the external reporting process. Assigned business/business partner areas are large and highly complex. Incumbent demonstrates extensive knowledge of regulatory reporting best practices and a specialized understanding with the corporate process standards established globally. Responsible for developing data, gathering processes and procedures, supporting analytics, and reporting controls. Recognized throughout the organization as the external reporting point of contact for a particular business/business partner areas. Gathers and reports useable, accurate and timely financial information for the entire spectrum of the reporting process to external reporters ensuring accuracy and correctness and transforms data where needed. In partnership with management, establishes the regulatory reporting strategy for the business/business partner area and is accountable for ensuring the implementation of that strategy. Leverages complex regulatory reporting techniques to achieve business objectives. Designs, builds and drives implementation activities to develop a common end-state reporting process in support of their direct supervisor and the global process owners. Sustains the integrity of the reporting process and addresses highly-complex external reporting matters associated with the process. Uses existing strategic relationships to influence at all levels of the organization. Liaises with internal and external regulators to ensure compliance to prescribed standards. Coordinates the delivery of process documentation, training content, and will advocate continuous improvement work efforts. Acts as a coach and mentor to less experienced team members to perform effectively in their role. No direct reports. Oversees, advises and guides less experienced External Reporting roles and may direct their work. Responsibilities are primarily specialized to address the external reporting management needs of a particular business/business partner area. However, tasks often produce cross-regional impacts. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications  Bachelor s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 7-10 years of experience in regulatory reporting preferred. Experience in external reporting and/or internal audit preferred. MBA Preferred, CPA is a plus.  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. As the strategy and analytics team leader, you will be responsible for accelerating, innovating, and improving productivity for our clients, products, and employees.
 
In addition to execution, this group partners across the bank to refine strategic efficiency priorities (e.g. automation strategy, BNYM role as a key contributor to the US financial market infrastructure etc.). You will work with both the Operations and Finance leadership teams to assess complex business and process issues, identify actionable opportunities for improvement, and quantify bottom line financial impact of recommendations. The lead will:


Oversee multiple projects, each of which have discrete problem-solving workstreams for which you will ultimately be responsible for delivering results
Serve variously as an individual strategic advisor, a project lead, or enlisting a full team from one of the supporting businesses we are engaged with, depending on need
Advise on, or assist in creating, metrics needed to measure overall improvement
Set overall Operations strategy (3-5 year view), conceiving and proposing initiatives against the strategy, and aligning teams and work plans to execute
Facilitate leadership discussions and investigatory interviews  
Structure and analyze various data sources to build a basis for decision making
Syndicate recommendations and advocate for appropriate funding for strategic priorities
Manage team of 3-5 associate/analysts Qualifications 
BS/BA required
10-15 years of overall experience preferred, with 3-5+ years consulting experience with a management consulting firm or an internal consulting function preferred
Experience in process improvement, particularly within an operations environment
Ability to effectively prioritize multiple projects and tasks
Proficient in Excel, Powerpoint  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. This individual will be expected to provide back up support and at times represent the Insurance Manager. The Senior Specialist, External Reporting works with senior management roles to ensure that the appropriate external reporting policies, methods, standards, processes, reporting and training are developed, applied and understood by impacted stakeholders. He/she has extensive knowledge of regulatory reporting processes and in-depth knowledge of compliance in regulatory bodies. 
 
The role will be in contact with various stakeholders from regional (Manchester) and global (Chennai) finance delivery center, finance management, external auditors and regulators. He/she will report directly to the Head of Regulatory, consolidation and statutory reporting for BNYM SANV. He will work in collaboration within a team of dedicated more experienced SME’s having similar responsibilities.
 
This role will be responsible for second review and oversight of production done out of Regional Service center for dedicated European (Pillar III, SHS…) and Belgian reports (Schema A, statistics…). This include verification of the work performed, controls of accuracy, completeness, compliance with high quality standard expected from stakeholders and making sure submission is done within required timeline including escalation of issues to the local management. 
 
This role will ensure completeness of proper description of control environment through maintenance of proper ICRR and documentation.  He/she will be help with support to internal audit, sox and external audit reviews. He/she will also be responsible to supervise or prepare response to adhoc queries from different regulators. 
 
The role will act as a Subject Matter expert to the dedicated reporting and will take care in collaboration with experienced colleagues of preparation of matters of interpretation in regards to the reporting regulation. He/she will also be engaged in different project to implement new requirements, new reporting on assess the impact of On-Boarding of new products on his/her dedicated reporting.
 
The role will work in collaboration with other finance stakeholders including LE controllers to improve regulatory reporting processes. 
 
Responsibilities within Brussels Finance:
 
1.       Review of Dedicated European and Belgian reporting :
 
Responsible of review of dedicated European or Belgian regulatory reporting: This include verification of the work performed by the regional delivery center, controls of accuracy, completeness, compliance with high quality standard expected from stakeholders and making sure submission is done within required timeline including escalation of issues to the local management. This includes the performance and evidence of control for management review and explanation of results to management through dedicated review meetings.
 
2.       Handling of Ad-hoc regulatory request :
 
Preparation or supervision of answers to dedicated adhoc regulatory request.
 
3.       Subject Matter Expert : 
 
He/she will take care of preparation of first draft with experienced colleagues of matters of interpretation in regards to the reporting regulation. He/she will also be engaged in different project to implement new requirements, new reporting on assess the impact of On-Boarding of new products on his/her dedicated reporting.
 
4.       Support with Audit : 
 
He/she will provide support to internal audit, Sox and external audit in their review of SANV processes.
 
5.       Follow up of regulatory development : 
 
He/she will monitor regulatory changes to his/her dedicated reporting requirements. He/she will analyse evolution to ensure the driving of relevant changes into the processes of the bank. 
  Qualifications ·        Education: University Degree in Economics, Engineering or Business Accounting qualification or equivalent
·        Experience: Over 3 years of relevant experience in European (CRD4, EBA, Pillar3 or SRB reporting) or Belgian reporting (Schema A, Statistics). Experience towards statutory reporting (IFRS FS, Schema B) is a plus 
·        Good communication skills able to adapt to the audience.
·        Great Team spirit able foster collaboration with people located outside of his group/location.
·        Language Skills: English/French or English/Dutch BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: Belgium-Brussels-Capital Region-Brussels Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85077 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1816169

column2: UK Finance Controls and Governance Analyst
column4:
Job Purpose: 
 As a Controls Analyst within the UK Controllers group you will support management in ensuring a robust, fit for purpose control environment for accounting, statutory and regulatory reporting. You will assist the team in ensuring that risks are identified, the key controls mitigating the risks are operating effectively and that there is accountability for managing them.   
 UK Controllers have outsourced core production activities to specialist service centres in Manchester and India.  You will work with these operational groups, updating the control metrics to clearly demonstrate our oversight of these activities. You will contribute to reporting for the Senior Stakeholders on a regular basis on key performance metrics associated with accounting and financial reporting controls.   
 You will also contribute to key controls processes such as disaster recovery coordination, banking administration and records management, working across UK finance to deliver programme requirements.  
 You should be willing to bring ideas to the table, and be able to communicate effectively with staff at a range of different levels. You should ideally have previous controls experience in a global environment. 
 Key responsibilities:
Governance


 Updating governance and controls framework documentation, working to deadlines and demonstrating compliance on request.  

 Assist in identifying process enhancements that will both strengthen the control environment and improve operational efficiency. 

 Monitor reported control issues, following up with responsible parties and escalating issues when appropriate. 

 The role will require you to build relationships across the Finance teams, service providers and external stakeholders. 
 
Reporting


 Contribute to reporting on programmes such as Operational Risk Events and Key Risk and Control Indicators.   

 Assist in co-ordination of monthly meetings with the specialist service centres, reviewing KPIs and other metrics to measure their effectiveness. 
 
Procedures & Compliance


 Work with the Controls team monitoring outsourced control activities, including banking administration, IMMS internal account population and ownership controls, MI reporting and reconciliation Quality Analysis. 

 Assist in maintaining and monitoring the control framework for records management for UK finance. 

 Help to maintain Senior Management Regime control documentation. 

 Assist in collation of quarter end attestation reporting. 

 Coordinate updates of Business Recovery documentation and changes to Banking system access. 
 
Person Specification/ Qualifications:


 Risk or controls specialist looking for hands on role. 

 Financial services experience and / or experience of large global organization preferred.  

 Risk management, controls and governance experience. 

 Project and outsourcing experiences would be desirable. 

 Excellent computer skills, in particular MS Power point and MS Excel. 

 Exposure to PeopleSoft general ledgers desirable, but not required. 
 
Core Competencies: 


 Good communicator 

 Ability to collaborate across teams, both within Finance and the wider organisation 

 Able to work in a complex global organisation 

 Be accountable for your deliverables    Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater Manchester-Manchester Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85083 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1817007

column2: Sr. Group Manager, Third Party Governance
column4:
The Senior Group Manager, Third Party Governance will report into the Head of Third Party Oversight and Administration and will help in building and managing a high performance and regulatory compliant Third Party Risk Assessment process across First Line of Defense domains in the enterprise. The job is a highly visible role and successful candidate will need to work closely with senior executives, including "C" level executives across the company. 
　
Primary Responsibilities Include: 
 
Creation of the process: Work with the consulting team that is helping establish Third Party Risk Assessment Methodology across the enterprise:


Work with various First Line of Defense Risk domains and establish a regulatory compliant risk assessment framework 
Help establish risk rules, risk appetite, set of mitigating controls, risk indicators, and recommended ongoing monitoring measures for each domain 
 
Creation of the system:Act as a key point-of-contact for the Systems team that is building a new enterprise wide Third Party Governance tool:


Work with the Systems team in developing the business requirements for all domains 
The new system business requirements should operationalize the risk assessment framework established in prior step
 
Operationalization of the system:
Once the Third Party Governance system is in place, help lead the effort to operationalizing the system 


Working with other stakeholders, help determine the operationalization sequence (sequence of groups that go to new system, timing, etc.) 
Lead the training, communication, and socialization aspects prior to the launch
Help in identifying, tracking, and resolving issues during the launch
BAU Risk Assessments and Ongoing MonitoringOnce the new system is implemented, establish and run an oversight process on the risk domains you are responsible for


Track and review the performance of each domain on a weekly basis for the domains 
Lead quarterly business reviews with each domain
Identify, track, and resolve any issues or roadblocks
Leadership Skills:


Working with domain owners, help build a strong, talented, resilient risk assessment teams across the enterprise
Responsible, along with domain owners, for the employee satisfaction scores of the risk assessment teams under each domain 
Communications:


Proactively communicate the progress and issues with stakeholders
Develop close relationships with key stakeholders across the company 
Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and is not afraid of hard work and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities. Given the exposure to many "C" level executives, this role will provide for bigger opportunities for successful candidates.  Qualifications * Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. 
* 12-15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience, preferred.
* Proven track record of managing and promoting team members is preferred.
* 3-5 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Procurement, Compliance, Legal, Audit, or Risk areas is preferred* MBA from a top institute is preferred, but not required* Management consulting experience is preferred, but not required* Operational experience is preferred, but not required* Project management experience is preferred, but not required * Process optimization experience is preferred, but not required* Technology experience is preferred, but not required
* Military experience is preferred, but not required

column2: Specialist, Travel & Expenses (Corporate Cards) Corporate Services
column4:
This position is responsible for the management of the Client Global Corporate Card & Purchasing Card program 
 The card program includes the issuance and cancelation of Corporate Travel (T&E) cards, maintenance of organizational hierarchy and production of management reporting, including managing any new implementations for new countries or new company acquisitions as appropriate. 
 Implementation of the purchasing card program to include strategy, vendor opportunity analysis, and training of cardholders. 
 This position proactively monitors spend for compliance to policy to minimize credit losses, and identify financial risk factors while working with stakeholders to resolve issues. 
 This role liaises with Shared Services / Expense Accounting to ensure policies and procedures are aligned, integration with Expense system is optimized and helpdesk teams are briefed to answer employee questions and cardholders receive appropriate support for escalation issues. 
 Responsible for documentation of procedures and communications to establish global standards to support implementation of best practices. 
 Issues exception/non-compliance reporting, management spend and supplier reporting to identify opportunity areas, manage vendor negotiations and to mitigate risk. 
 Responsible for creating communications and maintaining website information to assist cardholders to manage their accounts effectively and deliver customer service for our T&E, purchasing and meeting cardholders. 
 Ability to effectively manage and prioritize a heavy workload with completing priorities 
 Management presence; able to gain confidence and respect in skills, knowledge and ability with members of team as well as others within the organization at all levels 
 Outstanding people skills and ability to work effectively in a team based environment 
 Strong knowledge and understanding of travel industry.  
 Strong knowledge and understanding of commercial card programs. 
 No direct reports.  
 Job scope is typically limited to the quality and accuracy of own work.  
 Modified based upon local regulations/requirements.  
 Strong customer service, listening and communication skills 
 Demonstrated project management and leadership capability  
 Open minded – collaborator – willingness to think outside of the box 
 Ability to assess a situation objectively 
 Leverage travel spending to implement cost reduction/avoidance opportunities 
 Monitoring agreement usage and ensuring committed levels are maintained 
 Ensure organization’s travel objectives are met and travel policies are updated to align with travel industry trends and organizational needs  
 Monitor the performance of the travel management company and other travel suppliers to ensure quality and service levels 
 Identify trends, determine causes and develop and implement corrective action plans as appropriate 
 Communicate service and cost avoidance opportunities to employees 
 Build cross-functional partnerships and strategies to drive continuous program and process improvement and cost reductions 
 Day-to-day oversight and liaison with travel agency staff as well as travel suppliers (i.e. airlines, hotels, rental cars, ground transportation companies and corporate charge card provider)  
 Well rounded knowledge of the travel industry, technologies used for reservations systems and data collection 
 Requires a Bachelor's degree with emphasis in business or travel related subject matter.   Travel certification(s) such as CCTE preferred  
 Demonstrated written and verbal leadership skills and the ability to work independently and across functions are essential. Full working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel.  Must possess strong analytical, financial, oral and written communication skills.  Must be service oriented with exceptional interpersonal skills in order to communicate with all levels of company personnel and suppliers.  Must be skilled in problem solving, decision making and able to work against deadlines.  Knowledge of travel technology/e-commerce applications a plus.  Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. HedgeMark (“HM”), a BNY Mellon company, specializes in supporting institutional clients in the development and operation of their own private hedge fund dedicated managed account platforms (“DMA”).  HM supports clients information and structuring of their private vehicles, negotiating fund documents and counterparty agreements, and project managing each fund’s launch.  Post-launch, HM provides risk and performance reporting, transparency and investment guideline monitoring to the client.  HM is also responsible for performing operational and accounting functions which provide independent oversight and controls to the process.  

As of August 31, 2018, HM services 102 DMA funds with $11 Billion assets under management.  


The HedgeMark Onboarding Team is responsible for the following functions:

Project manage new client relationships, new fund launches and additional counterparty agreements
Lead introduction calls with new Investment Managers to explain HedgeMark’s managed account model and roles and responsibilities 
Work with structuring team to ensure all fund documents are negotiated and executed in a timely manner to meet project deadlines.
Take the lead on establishing counterparty trading agreements – take the lead in requesting new documentation from counterparties, ensuring drafts are received and negotiated (by the HedgeMark Structuring team or outside counsel), populating account opening forms, requesting daily reporting from counterparties from all relevant parties, and ensuring accounts are set up timely in order to launch new funds.
Serve as a point of contact for clients and investment manager queries.  Work with internal and external contacts to ensure queries are addressed in a timely manner.
The Junior Onboarder will work closely with Senior Onboarding staff in New York to support onboarding functions; in particular the process of counterparty agreements and account opening documentation.

Duties Include:

Support the Fund Structuring and Onboarding teams on new Hedge Fund structures.
Request documentation from counterparties and assist lead onboarder with meeting counterparty documentation requirements.
Documentation administration – assist with all counterparty account openings. Complete documentation, liaise with Fund governance provider for execution and update all relevant parties. 
Track status of all counterparty documentation and project plan items, and update internal systems with all statuses.
Follow up with counterparties on document and account opening status.
Ensure proper file maintenance. 
Keep meeting notes and update onboarding status. 
Interface with service providers including Administrators, Counterparties, Legal counsel etc. 
Special Projects

 Qualifications Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience in business management or related field is required. 
1-3 years of total work experience is strongly preferred in a project team and/or administrative role.
Ability to prioritize workload, provide project status updates and enter account application information in a timely fashion.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and excellent organizational skills are required.
Microsoft word and PDF document experience strongly preferred.
 
What we can offer you:

Full time contract of employment
Competitive salary
Health & Life Insurance
Multisport card / Cinema Tickets / Nursery subsidiary
Pension scheme
Excellent opportunities for training, growth and professional development
Opportunities to engage in diverse projects due to growth of business migrations
A multitude of opportunities to get involved in additional charity projects
A collaborative culture and great teams

column4:
Business Technology Liaison - IC3 
   Analyzes, defines and prioritizes business requirements and functional or operational specifications for moderate to large projects of increasing complexity. Provides consultation to all areas of IT and business management for the application of technology to support business opportunities and planning, implementation of cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project.

Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes business requirements. Translates into functional design and use case documents. Develops project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions. Plans and formulates aspects of development proposals including the objective or purpose of projects, existing applications that can be utilized, and equipment and human resource requirements.

Participates in and provides guidance on development of functional requirements and user documentation. Consults internal business groups on requirements, functional architecture and implementation.  Uses thorough knowledge of business needs to provide design support to software and application development teams.

Gathers and analyzes information to assist in the development of recommendations to address business objectives that span multiple business and technology areas. Works with business and technology teams to implement technology roadmap strategy.

Trains users on new or enhanced applications and/or systems of moderate complexity.  Serves as point of contact or subject matter expert for the business on specific systems.

Provides technical consultation concerning business implications of application development projects.  Supports testing of new or enhanced applications and/or systems and provides guidance to junior team members on case development, requirement traceability analysis, test preparation, script writing, and functional test execution.

Uses broad knowledge of regulatory and legal requirements and BNY Mellon corporate policies involving risk and control to support the development of improved business processes through technology.

No direct reports, provides guidance to less experienced colleagues. Leads projects and allocates work accordingly.

Contributes to the achievement of related teams objectives.    Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Technical experience and understanding of real estate operations/related concepts and/or strong accounting background preferred. 3+ years practical experience utilizing YARDI as a real estate accounting system for an owner, property management company, fund administrator or other investment service provider is strongly preferred (including but not limited to; set up, reporting and property management functions). Strongly preferred business knowledge of real estate as an investment, investment operations for property and fund administration functions, fund accounting/review preferable, and a strong knowledge of controls and procedures.  Business Analysis and Support Services (BASS) is a global team that operates in North America, Ireland, Poland and Germany and supports the different platforms and product lines within the Alternative Investment Services division. The main disciplines within the team are system support, project management and business analysis for Real Estate, Single manager, Private Equity and Fund of Funds.  The Analyst/support role involves supporting the Real Estate service delivery teams utilizing the Yardi platform to provide fund administration to real estate investment clients.  Key Responsibilities:Provide YARDI subject matter expertise and be the primary point of contact for "technical" advice and support to accounting and investor services users.Support Fund Accountants with the setup and design of Accounting Automation rules and with use of various Accounting and General Ledger Consolidation Methods such as Full Consolidation, Equity Method / Pickup, Minority Interest, NCI, etc.Support Fund Accountants with the setup, automation and tracking of various Cash and Income transactions that impact Investor Ledger, Capital Balances and related Cash Flows.Support Fund Accountants with the automation and reporting of Performance Returns including TWR, industry standard benchmarks such as NCREIF, IPD as well as ILPA / PERE reporting, etc.Assist in the preparation of Business Requirement Documents for systems enhancements and report enhancements/creation.Complete Quality Control testing for local user environment and be part of Quality Control global team.Participate in new client data conversions. Support the Client Servicing New business team. This will incorporate participation in project planning, assisting in the system set ups and user testing where applicable.Working with new and existing YARDI users to implement system developments and deliver training. Troubleshoot YARDI operational issues prior to referring to vendor for resolution.

Responsible for the ongoing, independent oversight of moderately complex business continuity compliance activities and recovery management governance for an assigned function and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other risks. Assists the assigned function with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Plans for standard business continuity risks and contributes to the function's activities to address any control gaps. Supports the business line managers via the cross company Business Recovery Coordinator network to ensure the company is meeting both client and regulatory requirements related to Business Continuity. This includes providing training and awareness on required deliverables, tracking and monitoring for completion, conducting quality assurance reviews and reporting back to management, as required. Independently assists the assigned function with the identification of risks to functional resilience and completion of test recoveries and relocations as required by all applicable regulators and legal entities. Helps the function to develop projects and programs to improve compliance. May complete similar tasks for vendor continuity. Contributes to the evaluation of testing protocols each year in response to personnel changes, among others. Consistently contributes to cross-functional efforts to promote a strong Business Continuity & Recovery culture throughout the organization. Assists with the drafting of the master resolution and recovery playbook for the organization, including documenting actions to be taken in the event of a crisis or bankruptcy. May attend meetings and continue to build relationships with existing clients to contribute to the completion of business continuity compliance activities when clients are in the process of purchasing new services or conducting due diligence required by their vendors. No direct reports. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements.   
   
 Responsible for the ongoing, independent oversight of business monitoring and incident response for Securities Operations and Cash and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other business risks. Assists Business Resiliency Intelligence (BRI) with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Prepares reports for more senior professionals. This role is responsible to provide key metrics and data that supports Incident management with preventative/analytics insight and BAU continuous improvement through deep data analytics. This role is responsible for real time monitoring for all securities processes and providing quantitative business impact analysis and incident response in a major incident/BCP and crisis situation.  As a senior analytics lead this role trigger escalations with Operations and technology partners/application teams incase of identified issues and is responsible for:  


 Monitoring service health for all Securities processes settlements, trade capture, corporate actions, income including strategic key metrics for the business eg: market impact, flow across the lifecycle, latency/throughput and application health (this role will be cross trained for Cash monitoring as well) 

 Planning for standard business continuity risks and contributes to the function's activities to address any control gaps  

 Engaging in daily triage calls with management in the CTOC (command center) including Cyber, Technology infrastructure, Applications production services teams for any major incidents impacting Securities and Cash services 

 Supporting contingency and triage situations with the data to help prioritization of transaction activity to minimize risk exposure 

 Validating resumption of services through monitoring (post resolution of a major incident) 

 Providing recommendations and analytics for BAU improvements to the business process for securities services  

 Assisting with development, implementation and continuous improvement of Securities processes and systems that drive compliant behavior and enable effective monitoring, including by performing system and data testing and performing any other tasks assigned to ensure accuracy and completeness ( 

 Interacting with executive management and clients for specific showcase visits to demonstrate monitoring capabilities   Qualifications Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 7-10 years of total work experience preferred. Conducts accounting services on behalf of assigned clients and complex real estate funds including determining net asset values, calculating fund performance, allocating expenses and preparing reports. Primarily responsible for the accurate and timely accounting and reporting for their assigned portfolios. The candidate should have a solid understanding of generally accepted accounting principles as it relates to fair market value of real estate and/or related investments. In addition, the candidate is required to assist in managing and completing multiple processes within tight deadlines while responding to various requests from many parties. Primary responsibilities will include:


Manages a team responsible for a variety of fund accounting and administration activities, including expense allocation, budgeting, cash allocation and compliance.
Manages processes and provides oversight of team to ensure that the daily positions of funds are calculated in accordance with departmental policies and procedures.
Manages fund expense budgeting and preparation of expense invoices for clients.
Provides input into methodologies and reviews complex work done by more junior team members. Provides guidance and reviews work related to cash and asset reconciliations relating to complex accounts. 
Manages relationships with assigned clients and ensures all questions are answered and issues are resolved.
Manages team in working with internal and external auditors to ensure they have information to conduct audits in an efficient manner.
Ensuring the timely and accurate preparation and review of quarterly data submission to various industry organizations and consultants. 
Constructing and/or leading various training classes - such as accounting for complex deal structures, record keeping within certain systems, and/or the rolling out of new or changes to existing processes.
Performs highly complex Fund/Client Accounting responsibilities in the areas of driving Service Improvement plans, targeting efficiencies, enhancing processes and specialist review functions. 
Recruits, directs, motivates and develops staff, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function effectively with their colleagues as a team.
Manages a team consisting of fund administration professionals; contributes to the achievement of team objectives.
 Qualifications


Bachelors degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
5-7 years of total work experience preferred; ideally this will include significant financial statement preparation and review experience and real estate fund accounting experience.
Additional preferences include: 

CPA
Working knowledge of joint venture waterfalls and partnership structures
REIT experience; Yardi and/or MRI system experience highly preferred
Advanced Excel experience
Strong leadership and development skills
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal, communication, and partnering skills

column2: Sr. Group Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG) - Policy Program Governance Lead
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Policy Program Governance Lead manages the program framework and associated evergreen governance process. The Lead would be the resident expert about the Third Party Risk and needs to build strong relationships with other first, second, and third lines of defenses in US and worldwide. The job is a highly visible role and the Lead will need to work closely with senior executives. 

Primary Responsibilities Include: 
   1. Creating the Regulatory Repository:
         a. The Lead is responsible for building a repository of guidance from all State, Federal, and international regulators that impact the Bank Third Party Governance program
         b. The Lead is responsible for creating a gap analysis to determine the differences among guidance from various regulators 
         c. The Lead needs to work with Legal, Compliance, and other teams to ensure that there is no redundancy of work being done among teams
   2. Creating the TPG Policies:
         a. The Lead is responsible creating the TPG policies that comply with guidance from regulators
         b. The Lead needs to create a traceability matrix at granular level that tracks the Policies to individual sections in guidance from regulators
   3. Helping with Controls:
         a. The Lead needs to participate and provide feedback during process design, inherent risk assessment, and creation of the compensating controls during the RCSA creation 
         b. The Lead should be available as the Policy subject matter expert to the Controls and other teams
   4. Creating and Managing the Evergreen Regulatory Compliant Policy Program
         a. The Lead needs to work with Legal, Compliance, and other teams to create and manage an ongoing evergreen regulatory compliant policy program. 
         b. The Lead is expected to obtain the regulatory changes from Legal/Compliance and determine what needs to change within TPG policies and execute on those changes.
   5. Helping with Regulatory Responses and Meetings
         a. The Lead is expected to help with all TPG regulatory meetings and regulatory responses.

Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities.
 Qualifications  
1.) Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. 
2.) 12-15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience, preferred.
3.) 3-5 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Risk, Procurement, Compliance, Legal, or Audit areas is preferred
4.) Operational experience is preferred, but not required
5.) column3:
Multiple Locations:
London, United Kingdom; Manchester, United Kingdom
column4:
This director level role is responsible for research and analysis of complex accounting and reporting issues for BNY Mellon, principally for its EMEA and APAC domiciled businesses.  This includes new and proposed generally accepted accounting principles under both U.S. GAAP and IFRS and is accomplished through financial research, data gathering, planning, and estimation of the impact to the Company.  This role has regular interface with senior management in Finance, business partners, line of business management, and the Company’s auditors.  He/she will often lead accounting change implementation teams, develop related Corporate Accounting Policies, and conduct training of Finance staff and other impacted users.  He/she will monitor proposed accounting standards, including liaising with peers at other financial institutions and participating in external professional groups.   
 This role will also perform ad hoc financial analyses requested by senior management and summarize the impact and any alternatives available to senior management.  Activities could include accounting treatment of acquisitions, divestitures, restructurings, capital market transactions, consolidations, impairments, financial instrument valuations, revenue/expense recognition, employee benefit programs, and differences between FASB and IFRS standards.  He/she may work with external vendors as needed such as valuation firms, actuaries and consultants.   
   
 Candidates should have extensive, broad-based knowledge of advanced financial accounting and reporting concepts and processes; knowledge of and experience in accounting and external reporting requirements in businesses conducted by BNY Mellon; familiarity with the reporting requirements under the U.S Securities and Exchange Commission; excellent verbal, writing and consultative skills; and proven ability to lead cross-functional teams.  Candidate should be proficient with personal computing/software to perform these duties, including systems-based research skills.  Strong business and strategic perspective/focus is essential.   
 The qualified candidate will be educated to degree level and have CPA, ACA or equivalent qualification.  Extensive knowledge of and experience applying U.S. GAAP and IFRS is required.  At least 12-15 years progressive accounting and financial analysis experience required, and experience in an Accounting Policy function with a financial institution or national accounting firm preferred.   
   
 
 #LI-SM1  
    Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater London-London Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85045 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1815548

column2: Senior Group Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG) Vendor Manager
column4:
The Senior Group Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG) Vendor Manager is a team member in the Third Party Vendor Management Group which is responsible for monitoring the onboarding and ongoing activities between BNY Mellon stakeholders and third parties. This leader collaborates with key business executives, business leaders, external Third Parties and internal subject matter experts to advance TPG program objectives, while adhering to all documented policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
•Provides guidance and consulting on third party governance, oversight, and risk mitigation approaches throughout the third party lifecycle to business operations and key stakeholders
•Helps maintain accurate risk profile reporting and dashboards, sharing the results with key stakeholders across the business 
•Leads the development of ongoing monitoring activities and protocols with third party relationships, bringing transparency to the residual risks of any engagements
•Validates and monitors controls across relevant risk domains as well as contractual adherence through carrying out regular remote and on-site visits with key third parties
•Ensures vendor risk exposures are accurately measured and reported, escalating issues to the relevant internal partner or subject matter expert to develop an appropriate remediation plan
•Coordinates with senior business leaders who serve the as Executive Sponsors for key vendors to oversee and manage their third party engagements
•Conducts business reviews for top vendors on a regular basis, enabling Engagement Managers and Engagement Sponsors to better manage vendor performance
•Serves as a strategic advisor for a portfolio of third party vendors, well versed in the details of specific engagements while simultaneously managing the broader list of vendors
•Recruits, directs, motivates and develops a staff of more junior managers, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function as a team or lead for their team

Nature and Scope:
•Reports to Executive Director, Third Party Vendor Management 
•This role has direct reports Qualifications
•Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required
•12-15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience, preferred.
•Experience in developing and managing teams preferred
•Experience in a large banking or financial institution as either an internal team member or as an external consultant is preferred
•Background in third party/vendor management and governance, procurement, or regulatory compliance is preferred
•Experience in Risk management organizations preferred  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Third Party Governance, Data & Analytics Manager
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Data & Analytics Manager is responsible for assisting in the development of a foundational data environment and scaling that environment across all third party systems to manage and report on the effectiveness of the TPG program. The candidate will have a strong background in (1) understanding, linking, and manipulating large datasets in databases, (2) deriving insights and meaning from the data, and (3) creating actionable reporting from the data to facilitate more efficient operation of the business.

Primary Responsibilities:
•Understand the reporting requirements for all stakeholders, including regulatory boards, board of directors, executives and line managers in adherence with data governance
•Work cross-functionally with multiple teams to obtain, cleanse, analyze, and reconcile required data
•Create accurate, timely, and well-controlled TPG reports for various stakeholders using tools like Excel, Tableau or Qlikview
•Formulate data compliance requirements, aggregating existing information and establishing new metrics into a data warehouse that will directly support a full scale TPG operation
•Utilize SQL to pull, manipulate, and link large amounts of data from disparate systems
•Synthesize data findings and statistics into actionable insights and stories for presenting to senior leadership
•Automate manual data processing and reporting procedures to create scalable and efficient solutions for TPG operations
•Manage multiple simultaneous projects and prioritize assignments and tasks accordingly, remaining flexible to changing priorities and new initiatives
•Recruit, direct, motivate and develop professional staff, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function as a team

Nature and Scope:
•Reports to Director, Third Party Governance (TPG)
•Has direct reports Qualifications
•Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience is required
•7-10 years of total work experience preferred
•Knowledge and experience with large-scale databases, data science, and business intelligence is preferred
•1-3 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Procurement, Strategy, Management Consulting, Compliance, Legal, Audit, Risk, Policies/Procedures areas is preferred
•1-3 years of experience managing teams, with a track record of promoting team members is preferred BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Responsible for the ongoing, independent oversight of moderately complex business continuity compliance activities and recovery management governance for an assigned function and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other risks. Assists the assigned function with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Plans for standard business continuity risks and contributes to the function's activities to address any control gaps. Supports the business line managers via the cross company Business Recovery Coordinator network to ensure the company is meeting both client and regulatory requirements related to Business Continuity. This includes providing training and awareness on required deliverables, tracking and monitoring for completion, conducting quality assurance reviews and reporting back to management, as required. Independently assists the assigned function with the identification of risks to functional resilience and completion of test recoveries and relocations as required by all applicable regulators and legal entities. Helps the function to develop projects and programs to improve compliance. May complete similar tasks for vendor continuity. Contributes to the evaluation of testing protocols each year in response to personnel changes, among others. Consistently contributes to cross-functional efforts to promote a strong Business Continuity & Recovery culture throughout the organization. Assists with the drafting of the master resolution and recovery playbook for the organization, including documenting actions to be taken in the event of a crisis or bankruptcy. May attend meetings and continue to build relationships with existing clients to contribute to the completion of business continuity compliance activities when clients are in the process of purchasing new services or conducting due diligence required by their vendors. No direct reports. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements.   
   
 Responsible for the ongoing, independent oversight of business monitoring and incident response for Securities Operations and Cash and in preparation for potential crises and technology and information losses, among other business risks. Assists Business Resiliency Intelligence (BRI) with the assessment of and monitoring and reporting on key indicators of business continuity and recovery preparedness. Prepares reports for more senior professionals. This role is responsible to provide key metrics and data that supports Incident management with preventative/analytics insight and BAU continuous improvement through deep data analytics. This role is responsible for real time monitoring for all securities processes and providing quantitative business impact analysis and incident response in a major incident/BCP and crisis situation.  As a senior analytics lead this role trigger escalations with Operations and technology partners/application teams incase of identified issues and is responsible for:  


 Monitoring service health for all Securities processes settlements, trade capture, corporate actions, income including strategic key metrics for the business eg: market impact, flow across the lifecycle, latency/throughput and application health (this role will be cross trained for Cash monitoring as well) 

 Planning for standard business continuity risks and contributes to the function's activities to address any control gaps  

 Engaging in daily triage calls with management in the CTOC (command center) including Cyber, Technology infrastructure, Applications production services teams for any major incidents impacting Securities and Cash services 

 Supporting contingency and triage situations with the data to help prioritization of transaction activity to minimize risk exposure 

 Validating resumption of services through monitoring (post resolution of a major incident) 

 Providing recommendations and analytics for BAU improvements to the business process for securities services  

 Assisting with development, implementation and continuous improvement of Securities processes and systems that drive compliant behavior and enable effective monitoring, including by performing system and data testing and performing any other tasks assigned to ensure accuracy and completeness ( 

 Interacting with executive management and clients for specific showcase visits to demonstrate monitoring capabilities   Qualifications Bachelor s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 7-10 years of total work experience preferred.
