Conducts accounting services on behalf of assigned clients and complex real estate funds including determining net asset values, calculating fund performance, allocating expenses and preparing reports. Primarily responsible for the accurate and timely accounting and reporting for their assigned portfolios. The candidate should have a solid understanding of generally accepted accounting principles as it relates to fair market value of real estate and/or related investments. In addition, the candidate is required to assist in managing and completing multiple processes within tight deadlines while responding to various requests from many parties. Primary responsibilities will include:


Manages a team responsible for a variety of fund accounting and administration activities, including expense allocation, budgeting, cash allocation and compliance.
Manages processes and provides oversight of team to ensure that the daily positions of funds are calculated in accordance with departmental policies and procedures.
Manages fund expense budgeting and preparation of expense invoices for clients.
Provides input into methodologies and reviews complex work done by more junior team members. Provides guidance and reviews work related to cash and asset reconciliations relating to complex accounts. 
Manages relationships with assigned clients and ensures all questions are answered and issues are resolved.
Manages team in working with internal and external auditors to ensure they have information to conduct audits in an efficient manner.
Ensuring the timely and accurate preparation and review of quarterly data submission to various industry organizations and consultants. 
Constructing and/or leading various training classes - such as accounting for complex deal structures, record keeping within certain systems, and/or the rolling out of new or changes to existing processes.
Performs highly complex Fund/Client Accounting responsibilities in the areas of driving Service Improvement plans, targeting efficiencies, enhancing processes and specialist review functions. 
Recruits, directs, motivates and develops staff, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function effectively with their colleagues as a team.
Manages a team consisting of fund administration professionals; contributes to the achievement of team objectives.
 Qualifications


Bachelors degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
5-7 years of total work experience preferred; ideally this will include significant financial statement preparation and review experience and real estate fund accounting experience.
Additional preferences include: 

CPA
Working knowledge of joint venture waterfalls and partnership structures
REIT experience; Yardi and/or MRI system experience highly preferred
Advanced Excel experience
Strong leadership and development skills
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal, communication, and partnering skills

column2: Regulatory Reporting Analyst - Sr. Specialist, External Reporting
column4: Manages the production and quality of the external reporting process. Assigned business/business partner areas are large and highly complex. Incumbent demonstrates extensive knowledge of regulatory reporting best practices and a specialized understanding with the corporate process standards established globally. Responsible for developing data, gathering processes and procedures, supporting analytics, and reporting controls. Recognized throughout the organization as the external reporting point of contact for a particular business/business partner areas. Gathers and reports useable, accurate and timely financial information for the entire spectrum of the reporting process to external reporters ensuring accuracy and correctness and transforms data where needed. In partnership with management, establishes the regulatory reporting strategy for the business/business partner area and is accountable for ensuring the implementation of that strategy. Leverages complex regulatory reporting techniques to achieve business objectives. Designs, builds and drives implementation activities to develop a common end-state reporting process in support of their direct supervisor and the global process owners. Sustains the integrity of the reporting process and addresses highly-complex external reporting matters associated with the process. Uses existing strategic relationships to influence at all levels of the organization. Liaises with internal and external regulators to ensure compliance to prescribed standards. Coordinates the delivery of process documentation, training content, and will advocate continuous improvement work efforts. Acts as a coach and mentor to less experienced team members to perform effectively in their role. No direct reports. Oversees, advises and guides less experienced External Reporting roles and may direct their work. Responsibilities are primarily specialized to address the external reporting management needs of a particular business/business partner area. However, tasks often produce cross-regional impacts. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Bachelor s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 7-10 years of experience in regulatory reporting preferred. Experience in external reporting and/or internal audit preferred. column2: Sr. Group Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG) - Policy Program Governance Lead
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Policy Program Governance Lead manages the program framework and associated evergreen governance process. The Lead would be the resident expert about the Third Party Risk and needs to build strong relationships with other first, second, and third lines of defenses in US and worldwide. The job is a highly visible role and the Lead will need to work closely with senior executives. 

Primary Responsibilities Include: 
   1. Creating the Regulatory Repository:
         a. The Lead is responsible for building a repository of guidance from all State, Federal, and international regulators that impact the Bank Third Party Governance program
         b. The Lead is responsible for creating a gap analysis to determine the differences among guidance from various regulators 
         c. The Lead needs to work with Legal, Compliance, and other teams to ensure that there is no redundancy of work being done among teams
   2. Creating the TPG Policies:
         a. The Lead is responsible creating the TPG policies that comply with guidance from regulators
         b. The Lead needs to create a traceability matrix at granular level that tracks the Policies to individual sections in guidance from regulators
   3. Helping with Controls:
         a. The Lead needs to participate and provide feedback during process design, inherent risk assessment, and creation of the compensating controls during the RCSA creation 
         b. The Lead should be available as the Policy subject matter expert to the Controls and other teams
   4. Creating and Managing the Evergreen Regulatory Compliant Policy Program
         a. The Lead needs to work with Legal, Compliance, and other teams to create and manage an ongoing evergreen regulatory compliant policy program. 
         b. The Lead is expected to obtain the regulatory changes from Legal/Compliance and determine what needs to change within TPG policies and execute on those changes.
   5. Helping with Regulatory Responses and Meetings
         a. The Lead is expected to help with all TPG regulatory meetings and regulatory responses.

Ideal candidate will be an ambitious, energetic, go-getter, who welcomes challenges and views this role as a proving ground for bigger opportunities.
 Qualifications  
1.) Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. 
2.) 12-15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience, preferred.
3.) 3-5 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Risk, Procurement, Compliance, Legal, or Audit areas is preferred
4.) Operational experience is preferred, but not required
5.) column3:
Multiple Locations:
London, United Kingdom; Manchester, United Kingdom
column4:
This director level role is responsible for research and analysis of complex accounting and reporting issues for BNY Mellon, principally for its EMEA and APAC domiciled businesses.  This includes new and proposed generally accepted accounting principles under both U.S. GAAP and IFRS and is accomplished through financial research, data gathering, planning, and estimation of the impact to the Company.  This role has regular interface with senior management in Finance, business partners, line of business management, and the Company’s auditors.  He/she will often lead accounting change implementation teams, develop related Corporate Accounting Policies, and conduct training of Finance staff and other impacted users.  He/she will monitor proposed accounting standards, including liaising with peers at other financial institutions and participating in external professional groups.   
 This role will also perform ad hoc financial analyses requested by senior management and summarize the impact and any alternatives available to senior management.  Activities could include accounting treatment of acquisitions, divestitures, restructurings, capital market transactions, consolidations, impairments, financial instrument valuations, revenue/expense recognition, employee benefit programs, and differences between FASB and IFRS standards.  He/she may work with external vendors as needed such as valuation firms, actuaries and consultants.   
   
 Candidates should have extensive, broad-based knowledge of advanced financial accounting and reporting concepts and processes; knowledge of and experience in accounting and external reporting requirements in businesses conducted by BNY Mellon; familiarity with the reporting requirements under the U.S Securities and Exchange Commission; excellent verbal, writing and consultative skills; and proven ability to lead cross-functional teams.  Candidate should be proficient with personal computing/software to perform these duties, including systems-based research skills.  Strong business and strategic perspective/focus is essential.   
 The qualified candidate will be educated to degree level and have CPA, ACA or equivalent qualification.  Extensive knowledge of and experience applying U.S. GAAP and IFRS is required.  At least 12-15 years progressive accounting and financial analysis experience required, and experience in an Accounting Policy function with a financial institution or national accounting firm preferred.   
   
 
 #LI-SM1  
    Qualifications . BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater London-London Job: Finance/Accounting Internal Jobcode: 85045 Organization: Finance-HR06599 Requisition Number: 1815548

column2: Senior Group Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG) Vendor Manager
column4:
The Senior Group Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG) Vendor Manager is a team member in the Third Party Vendor Management Group which is responsible for monitoring the onboarding and ongoing activities between BNY Mellon stakeholders and third parties. This leader collaborates with key business executives, business leaders, external Third Parties and internal subject matter experts to advance TPG program objectives, while adhering to all documented policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
•Provides guidance and consulting on third party governance, oversight, and risk mitigation approaches throughout the third party lifecycle to business operations and key stakeholders
•Helps maintain accurate risk profile reporting and dashboards, sharing the results with key stakeholders across the business 
•Leads the development of ongoing monitoring activities and protocols with third party relationships, bringing transparency to the residual risks of any engagements
•Validates and monitors controls across relevant risk domains as well as contractual adherence through carrying out regular remote and on-site visits with key third parties
•Ensures vendor risk exposures are accurately measured and reported, escalating issues to the relevant internal partner or subject matter expert to develop an appropriate remediation plan
•Coordinates with senior business leaders who serve the as Executive Sponsors for key vendors to oversee and manage their third party engagements
•Conducts business reviews for top vendors on a regular basis, enabling Engagement Managers and Engagement Sponsors to better manage vendor performance
•Serves as a strategic advisor for a portfolio of third party vendors, well versed in the details of specific engagements while simultaneously managing the broader list of vendors
•Recruits, directs, motivates and develops a staff of more junior managers, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function as a team or lead for their team

Nature and Scope:
•Reports to Executive Director, Third Party Vendor Management 
•This role has direct reports Qualifications
•Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required
•12-15 years of total work experience, with 3-5 years of management experience, preferred.
•Experience in developing and managing teams preferred
•Experience in a large banking or financial institution as either an internal team member or as an external consultant is preferred
•Background in third party/vendor management and governance, procurement, or regulatory compliance is preferred
•Experience in Risk management organizations preferred  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Third Party Governance, Data & Analytics Manager
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG) - Data & Analytics Manager is responsible for assisting in the development of a foundational data environment and scaling that environment across all third party systems to manage and report on the effectiveness of the TPG program. The candidate will have a strong background in (1) understanding, linking, and manipulating large datasets in databases, (2) deriving insights and meaning from the data, and (3) creating actionable reporting from the data to facilitate more efficient operation of the business.

Primary Responsibilities:
•Understand the reporting requirements for all stakeholders, including regulatory boards, board of directors, executives and line managers in adherence with data governance
•Work cross-functionally with multiple teams to obtain, cleanse, analyze, and reconcile required data
•Create accurate, timely, and well-controlled TPG reports for various stakeholders using tools like Excel, Tableau or Qlikview
•Formulate data compliance requirements, aggregating existing information and establishing new metrics into a data warehouse that will directly support a full scale TPG operation
•Utilize SQL to pull, manipulate, and link large amounts of data from disparate systems
•Synthesize data findings and statistics into actionable insights and stories for presenting to senior leadership
•Automate manual data processing and reporting procedures to create scalable and efficient solutions for TPG operations
•Manage multiple simultaneous projects and prioritize assignments and tasks accordingly, remaining flexible to changing priorities and new initiatives
•Recruit, direct, motivate and develop professional staff, maximizing their individual contribution, their professional growth and their ability to function as a team

Nature and Scope:
•Reports to Director, Third Party Governance (TPG)
•Has direct reports Qualifications
•Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience is required
•7-10 years of total work experience preferred
•Knowledge and experience with large-scale databases, data science, and business intelligence is preferred
•1-3 years of experience in Third Party Governance, Procurement, Strategy, Management Consulting, Compliance, Legal, Audit, Risk, Policies/Procedures areas is preferred
•1-3 years of experience managing teams, with a track record of promoting team members is preferred BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. With minimal guidance, performs the assessment of IT components within internal controls over financial reporting to ensure compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act ('SOX').  The Analyst is responsible for Month end close activities and preparing General Ledger Balance Sheet Account Reconciliations. The key role includes:
 

3 to 5 year experience in Month end close and reconciliations

Summary:
 
This is an entry role into the Pershing Financial Controllers team for a part qualified accountant with some prior experience in financial statements for a financial services company.  This role will support all team members. This varied role will involve liaison and review of Chennai based work; review of Blackline reconciliations; investigation into cost drivers and financial statements preparation/review. The role supports a financial services legal entity and contributes to the completion of numerous activities from start to close, including consolidations and financial reporting of business outcomes to deliver useable, accurate and timely financial information for the desired period (monthly, quarterly or annually).
 
Primary Responsibilities:
 


 Assists with end to end accounting processes and research required to transform data into information for reporting purposes. Activities may include processing standard general ledger events and transactions, assisting with continuous improvement activities such as the identification and analysis of exceptions, providing support for audits and completing assigned tasks to support the maintenance of the control environment. May complete special project activities, as assigned. 

 Contributes to the completion of journal entries. With guidance, performs reconciliations of general ledger accounts or other financial data. Identifies and escalates issues, as needed. May review journal entries and/or reconciliations completed by less experienced professionals.  

 Participates in assignments across lines of business, legal entities and geographies that have an impact on internal reporting, accounting and accounting processes. Assignments may include contributing to the implementation of new or revised reporting, accounting and accounting process policies, procedures and reporting templates in order to provide effective financial planning, accounting and reporting of financial information.   

 Contributes to the identification and reporting of risks, patterns or recurring issues. 

 Supports preparation of annual financial statements: 


 Support offshore preparers of the financial statements, monitoring their progress and advising on missing information 

 Initial reviews of each draft following submission by offshore preparers 

 Preparation of note information 

 Oversight of offsetting note information 

 Supports monthly accounting for costs  


 Analyse key cost items including Clearing charges and re-engineer approach to ensure correct payments and analysis 

 Analyse Inter-company costs to ensure correct payments 

 Month end reviews of accruals and general costs with Chennai  

 Purchase ledger oversight of offshore team, supporting UK managers with their queries 

 Review of blackline reconciliations relating to costs and general accounting 

 Any other ad hoc tasks as required to support the team eg records management 
  Qualifications Requirements:


 Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of accounting education  

 3-5 years of total work experience, within a financial services environment 

 Knowledge of GAAP and accounting and finance concepts and analysis techniques  

 System knowledge of Peoplesoft GL, Nexus, Blackline reconciliation tool, Swift Alliance 

 Experience designing financial models and accounting processes preferred 

 Can-do attitude to enhance the team on a pro-active basis 

 Analytical mind to review 

 Strong ethic for challenging controls and their effectiveness 

 Able to work as part of a team and individually on a wide variety of tasks 

 Relationship management with offshore providers

The SOX-ICRR Specialist will be part of a team assessing the effectiveness of internal controls over regulatory reporting (ICRR).  Team member will assist in the execution of the annual ICRR assessment program, including planning, testing, documentation and reporting.  S/He should be able to assess processes, identify control deficiencies, provide recommendations and prepare workpapers and documentation to support conclusions.  Additionally, this position will be responsible for developing end-to-end process flows, risk and control matrixes, identifying gaps and potential areas of improvement in the report preparation process for externally-filed reports.  Candidates must demonstrate a breadth of compliance and control knowledge with a thorough understanding of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX).  Strong excel and organization skills are required.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in public accounting, SOX testing, financial services or shared services is preferred. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Chartered Accountant (CA) certification is preferred. column2: Third Party Governance (TPG), Process Execution Analyst
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG), Process Execution Analyst is a team member in the Third Party Governance Process Automation Group which is responsible for delivering operational capability to perform the necessary functions to execute the risk management and reporting requirements for the interactions between BNY Mellon and the various Third Party entities that provide services to BNY Mellon.

Responsibilities:
     •Develop thorough understanding of the business needs and goals that guide the BNY Mellon TPG organization
     •Gain and exhibit subject matter expertise on assigned areas of focus; responsible for oversight and execution of one or more processes within the larger TPG program
     •Key input on business process evaluation and design and procedural development
     •Partner with cross functional teams in determining and defining business needs and requirements including developing and executing project plans, risk assessments, communication plans, implementation plans, training, and change management 
     •Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects and processes to ensure alignment and progress towards business goals
     •Partner with the adjacent groups within the TPG organization to execute process automation solutions to meet the business needs

Nature and Scope:
     •Reports to Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG)
     •No Direct reports Qualifications
     •Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Engineering or related discipline is preferred
     •5-7 years of total work experience preferred
     •Experience in a large banking or financial institution as either an internal team member or as an external consultant is preferred
     •Background in third party/vendor management and governance, procurement, or regulatory compliance is preferred
     •Experience working with large data sets, unstructured data, and complex organizational processes is preferred
     •Experience with financial sector Third Party Governance systems and tools is preferred
 
#LI-CH1 BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. column2: Third Party Governance (TPG), Process Design & Automation Analyst
column4:
The Third Party Governance (TPG), Process Design & Automation Analyst is a team member in the Third Party Governance Process Automation Group which is responsible for delivering operational capability to perform the necessary functions to execute the risk management and reporting requirements for the interactions between BNY Mellon and the various Third Party entities that provide services to BNY Mellon.

Responsibilities
     •Develop thorough understanding of the business needs and goals that guide the BNY Mellon TPG organization
     •Gain and exhibit subject matter expertise on assigned areas of focus and workstreams within the larger TPG process and systems delivery program
     •Business process evaluation and design, procedural development, systems requirements definition, and input on systems functional design
     •Partner with cross functional teams in determining and defining business needs and requirements including developing and executing project plans, risk assessments, communication plans, implementation plans, training, and change management 
     •Use information derived from performing the necessary data analysis to support alternatives and solutions to requirements that meets the business objectives and timelines 
     •Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects and processes to ensure alignment and progress towards business goals
     •Cross functional partnership with the technology team to implement and configure various software tools (workflow management, third party risk management, master data management) to ensure efficient management of the program across the enterprise
     •Partner with the adjacent groups within the TPG organization to ensure process automation solutions meet the business needs

Nature and Scope
     •Reports to Manager, Third Party Governance (TPG)
     •No Direct reports
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications
     •Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Engineering or related discipline is preferred
     •5-7 years of total work experience preferred
     •Experience in a large banking or financial institution as either an internal team member or as an external consultant is preferred
     •Background in third party/vendor management and governance, procurement, or regulatory compliance is preferred
     •Experience working with large data sets, unstructured data, and complex organizational processes is preferred
     •Experience with financial sector Third Party Governance systems and tools is preferred BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Summary:
 
This is an entry role into the Pershing Financial Controllers team for a part qualified accountant with some prior experience in financial statements for a financial services company.  This role will support all team members. This varied role will involve liaison and review of Chennai based work; review of Blackline reconciliations; investigation into cost drivers and financial statements preparation/review. The role supports a financial services legal entity and contributes to the completion of numerous activities from start to close, including consolidations and financial reporting of business outcomes to deliver useable, accurate and timely financial information for the desired period (monthly, quarterly or annually).
 
Primary Responsibilities:
 


 Assists with end to end accounting processes and research required to transform data into information for reporting purposes. Activities may include processing standard general ledger events and transactions, assisting with continuous improvement activities such as the identification and analysis of exceptions, providing support for audits and completing assigned tasks to support the maintenance of the control environment. May complete special project activities, as assigned. 

 Contributes to the completion of journal entries. With guidance, performs reconciliations of general ledger accounts or other financial data. Identifies and escalates issues, as needed. May review journal entries and/or reconciliations completed by less experienced professionals.  

 Participates in assignments across lines of business, legal entities and geographies that have an impact on internal reporting, accounting and accounting processes. Assignments may include contributing to the implementation of new or revised reporting, accounting and accounting process policies, procedures and reporting templates in order to provide effective financial planning, accounting and reporting of financial information.   

 Contributes to the identification and reporting of risks, patterns or recurring issues. 

 Supports preparation of annual financial statements: 


 Support offshore preparers of the financial statements, monitoring their progress and advising on missing information 

 Initial reviews of each draft following submission by offshore preparers 

 Preparation of note information 

 Oversight of offsetting note information 

 Supports monthly accounting for costs  


 Analyse key cost items including Clearing charges and re-engineer approach to ensure correct payments and analysis 

 Analyse Inter-company costs to ensure correct payments 

 Month end reviews of accruals and general costs with Chennai  

 Purchase ledger oversight of offshore team, supporting UK managers with their queries 

 Review of blackline reconciliations relating to costs and general accounting 

 Any other ad hoc tasks as required to support the team eg records management 
  Qualifications Requirements:


 Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of accounting education  

 3-5 years of total work experience, within a financial services environment 

 Knowledge of GAAP and accounting and finance concepts and analysis techniques  

 System knowledge of Peoplesoft GL, Nexus, Blackline reconciliation tool, Swift Alliance 

 Experience designing financial models and accounting processes preferred 

 Can-do attitude to enhance the team on a pro-active basis 

 Analytical mind to review 

 Strong ethic for challenging controls and their effectiveness 

 Able to work as part of a team and individually on a wide variety of tasks 

 Relationship management with offshore providers

The SOX-ICRR Specialist will be part of a team assessing the effectiveness of internal controls over regulatory reporting (ICRR).  Team member will assist in the execution of the annual ICRR assessment program, including planning, testing, documentation and reporting.  S/He should be able to assess processes, identify control deficiencies, provide recommendations and prepare workpapers and documentation to support conclusions.  Additionally, this position will be responsible for developing end-to-end process flows, risk and control matrixes, identifying gaps and potential areas of improvement in the report preparation process for externally-filed reports.  Candidates must demonstrate a breadth of compliance and control knowledge with a thorough understanding of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX).  Strong excel and organization skills are required.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in public accounting, SOX testing, financial services or shared services is preferred. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Chartered Accountant (CA) certification is preferred.  BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. With minimal guidance, performs the assessment of internal controls over financial reporting to ensure compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act ('SOX'). Assigned business/business partner areas are typically small to medium in size and may be complex. Incumbents demonstrate a breadth of knowledge of compliance and control and a thorough understanding of SOX. Supports senior team members in the execution of the SOX assessment program, in providing thorough and reliable identification of in-scope accounts and locations, planning, testing, documentation, and reporting of the effectiveness of financial reporting for delivery to the senior management and external committees. With minimal guidance, assesses business processes, identifies control deficiencies and recommendations, and prepares work papers and documentation to support the annual assessment. Supports more senior colleagues by tracking the status of deficiencies; reviews remediation by process owners and delivers reporting findings to SOX leadership and management. With some supervision, helps to provide support for the integration of internal controls into finance processes and systems to other members of the organization. No direct reports.  Qualifications Bachelor s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 5-7 years of experience in information risk preferred. Experience in public accounting, SOX testing, financial services or shared services is preferred. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Chartered Accountant (CA) certification is preferred. Contributes to the accounting activities of multiple complex legal entities, lines of business, countries, regions or accounting processes. Independently supports end to end accounting processes and completes complex research required to transform data into information for reporting purposes. Completes accounting activities, including processing numerous complex general ledger events and transactions, continuously improving exceptions identification and analysis activities, participating in audits, maintaining the control environment, fulfilling ad hoc requests in accordance with global, regional and country-specific process standards and identifying and completing process improvements. Delivers recommendations for use in accounting and financial reporting to senior management and the internal board of directors. Completes special project activities. Responsible for posting journal entries to the general ledger accounts accurately, completely and in a timely manner. Responsible for identifying and reporting risks, patterns or recurring issues and working with all necessary parties and technical teams to reach a resolution. Designs sophisticated analytical/computer methodologies and uses well developed written and oral communication skills to communicate complex financial data. Is building relationships to ensure questions from regulators, senior management and line of business are answered and needs are met. No direct reports. Provides guidance to more junior staff. column2: Sr. Relationship Manager - Office of Regulatory Relations
column4:
The Sr. Relationship Manager – Office of Regulatory Relations develops and cultivates the overall firm relationship with U.S. regulators. The successful candidate will be responsible for the following: 


 Knows and understands our U.S. regulators, acting as the single point of contact for questions, concerns, and feedback 

 Navigates our company on behalf of the regulators, guiding them to applicable sources of expertise 

 Develops and manages the engagement strategy for executive leadership with our U.S. regulators 

 Changes our mindset of our U.S. regulators as preferred clients 

 Manages regular meetings with U.S. Regulators 

 Understands the implications of U.S. regulatory messages and helps interpret them back to the business 

 Maps organization contacts to their U.S. regulatory counterparts 

 Establishes policies and procedures related to U.S. regulatory interaction and management 

 Contributes to development of the strategic objectives for Relationship Management with U.S. regulators.  Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Advanced/graduate degree preferred. 10-15 years of total work experience preferred with 3-5 years of management experience preferred. Financial Services experience and prior experience in Relationship Management. Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business.

column2: Specialist, Fund/Client Accounting (Private Equity Fund Accounting and Waterfall Analysis)
column4:
BNY Mellon is seeking a qualified candidate to manage the migration of Private Equity Funds onto the end-state waterfall solution.  This Manager will lead the project implementation team that supports the conversion of Funds onto Cascade Suite, an automated waterfall vendor solution that is integrated with Investran, the current accounting platform for the Alternative Investment Services group.  In addition, this person will oversee the development of Excel models that support complex waterfall calculations.  Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required • 7+ years of Private Equity Fund accounting experience, including waterfall analysis and specification and/or development strongly preferred • Investran and Cascade proficiency strongly preferred • Waterfall Software strongly preferred • Advanced Excel required; VBA programming a strong plus • Strong analytical and quantitative skills • Ability to read and analyze a Fund Limited Partnership Agreement (“LPA”), the legal document that governs the waterfall calculation strongly preferred • Ability to translate language from LPA to business requirements strongly preferred • Desire and proven ability to master accounting applications strongly preferred • Experience in large systems conversion projects a plus strongly preferred  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. Contributes to the accounting activities of multiple complex legal entities, lines of business, countries, regions or accounting processes. Manages numerous activities from start to close, including consolidations and financial reporting of business outcomes to deliver useable, accurate and timely financial information and recommendations for the desired period (monthly, quarterly or annually). May assign tasks to more junior professionals. Completes other complex accounting activities, as needed. Frequently delivers presentations, information and/or recommendations to senior management, the internal board of directors and regulators. Independently supports end to end accounting processes and completes complex research required to transform data into information for reporting purposes. Completes accounting activities, including processing numerous complex general ledger events and transactions, continuously improving exceptions identification and analysis activities, participating in audits, maintaining the control environment, fulfilling ad hoc requests in accordance with global, regional and country-specific process standards and identifying and completing process improvements. Delivers recommendations for use in accounting and financial reporting to senior management and the internal board of directors. Completes special project activities. Responsible for posting journal entries to the general ledger accounts accurately, completely and in a timely manner. Independently performs reconciliations of general ledger accounts or other financial data. Identifies, addresses and/or escalates issues, as needed. Reviews and/or approves journal entries and/or reconciliations completed by less experienced team members for accuracy and legibility and advises on improvements. Participates in assignments across lines of business, legal entities and geographies that have an impact on internal and external reporting, accounting and accounting processes. Assignments include contributing to the design and implementation of new or revised reporting, accounting and accounting process policies, procedures and reports which provide effective financial planning, accounting and reporting of financial information. Provides accounting guidance to relevant stakeholders. Responsible for identifying and reporting risks, patterns or recurring issues and working with all necessary parties and technical teams to reach a resolution. Recognizes significant risks and communicates these to management. Provides supervisory direction and technical guidance on risk identification to other analysts. Designs sophisticated analytical/computer methodologies and uses well developed written and oral communication skills to communicate complex financial data. Is building relationships to ensure questions from regulators, senior management and line of business are answered and needs are met. No direct reports. Provides guidance to more junior staff. Reviews work completed by less experienced staff. Contributes to the achievement of multiple complex legal entities, lines of business, countries, regions or accounting processes' objectives. Modified based upon local regulations/requirements. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. Accounting concentration preferred. MBA or CPA/CA/local area equivalent certification preferred. 7-10 years of total work experience preferred; knowledge of GAAP and accounting and finance concepts and analysis techniques preferred. Experience designing financial models and accounting processes preferred. column2: Sr. Relationship Manager - Office of Regulatory Relations
column4:
The Sr. Relationship Manager – Office of Regulatory Relations develops and cultivates the overall firm relationship with U.S. regulators. The successful candidate will be responsible for the following: 


 Knows and understands our U.S. regulators, acting as the single point of contact for questions, concerns, and feedback 

 Navigates our company on behalf of the regulators, guiding them to applicable sources of expertise 

 Develops and manages the engagement strategy for executive leadership with our U.S. regulators 

 Changes our mindset of our U.S. regulators as preferred clients 

 Manages regular meetings with U.S. Regulators 

 Understands the implications of U.S. regulatory messages and helps interpret them back to the business 

 Maps organization contacts to their U.S. regulatory counterparts 

 Establishes policies and procedures related to U.S. regulatory interaction and management 

 Contributes to development of the strategic objectives for Relationship Management with U.S. regulators.  Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Advanced/graduate degree preferred. 10-15 years of total work experience preferred with 3-5 years of management experience preferred. Financial Services experience and prior experience in Relationship Management. Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business.

column2: Specialist, Fund/Client Accounting (Private Equity Fund Accounting and Waterfall Analysis)
column4:
BNY Mellon is seeking a qualified candidate to manage the migration of Private Equity Funds onto the end-state waterfall solution.  This Manager will lead the project implementation team that supports the conversion of Funds onto Cascade Suite, an automated waterfall vendor solution that is integrated with Investran, the current accounting platform for the Alternative Investment Services group.  In addition, this person will oversee the development of Excel models that support complex waterfall calculations.  Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in accounting or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required • 7+ years of Private Equity Fund accounting experience, including waterfall analysis and specification and/or development strongly preferred • Investran and Cascade proficiency strongly preferred • Waterfall Software strongly preferred • Advanced Excel required; VBA programming a strong plus • Strong analytical and quantitative skills • Ability to read and analyze a Fund Limited Partnership Agreement (“LPA”), the legal document that governs the waterfall calculation strongly preferred • Ability to translate language from LPA to business requirements strongly preferred • Desire and proven ability to master accounting applications strongly preferred • Experience in large systems conversion projects a plus strongly preferred  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. The EMEA Finance Regional Shared Service Centre (RSSC) has grown significantly over the past 4 years with the ever-changing requirements from our Regulators. The team are made up of very strong accountants, who prepare reports relating to balance sheet, P&L, capital and liquidity.
Responsibilities: (Key parts to the job role)The role involves production of EMEA external regulatory and statistical reporting within prescribed regulatory deadlines and production of internal regulatory reporting for business management and decision making, including daily monitoring of internal reports for capital adequacy, liquidity and large exposures, monthly dashboards on capital and liquidity and submissions to the US head office regulatory team.
• Prepare/post journal entries for complex business transactions and inter-company transactions• Reconcile general ledger accounts and/or bank accounts • Perform accruals, adjustments, and intercompany transactions• Assist with the month end, quarter-end and the year-end close• Perform basic research of financial data to support senior colleagues in the analysis of financial information.  • Identify and resolve exceptions
  Qualifications
